name: Hilton Hawaiian Village Waikiki Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the Hilton in August for our honeymoon, this is a fantastic hotel. We stayed in the Rainbow Tower and the view of the beach was great. You did have to be careful about the water and coffee provided in the room as it was very expensive and the ABC store in the Hilton was also expensive. However Honolulu is full of ABC stores.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: We would definitely recomend this hotel, the pool is small but who needs the pool when the hotel is on the beach and the sea is so warm and clean.
reviews.title: Hotel Getting Away With This !
Frustrating Service
reviews.text: You are greeted with a pounding jackhammer that goes through the entire Tapa Tower for the duration of your stay.They dont warn you - when in fact they should not be open for business during such conditions. They of course take your money and leave you hanging. We had less than one hour to go before check out on our last day and the water was shut off ! and again they gave NO WARNING to anyone, no memo or signs, they dont think they need to let you know? We were this close to missing our flight, because of this-they made us run to another tower to shower-it was chaos. I wish I would have read trip advisors reviews before going there-as others had the exact same complaints! Never again!

Just at the HHV with a group for last week of September. There were little problems throughout, (check-in dates, room switches for repairs). Most frustrating was the response time TO the problems. Every time a question came up, the first response from the hotel was "There's nothing we can do." Only after getting face-to-face with people in authority were solutions arrived. Lower-level staff were deer in headlights.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: I wanted to write a review because the reviews had been really helpful to me and my trip.
reviews.title: The Hilton Hawaiian Village lives up to it's name

likes.liked: — Very luxurious rooms; everything you want is at the Hilton Hawaiian Village
likes.disliked: — Too big. Easy to get lost.

reviews.title: Absolutely Disgusted
reviews.text: I booked my holiday for early December this year, back in March, I have paid the final deposits this week, and finalised my trip. My Travel Agent was contacted today requesting that both myself and my partner fill out and sign disclosure forms, agreeing to not complain or request compensation for renovation works that the resort is currently under going.

reviews.title: Fabulous!!!!
reviews.text: Furthermore, it also includes a statement saying that if during the time we are there, there are no rooms avaliable to us due to these works that any cost in relocating us to another resort would be at our expense...

reviews.title: I love this great resort!!!!!
reviews.text: I am absolutely disgusted to think that I have paid out so much money, to be given this treatment... Also I would love to know why neither myself or my travel agent were told about these renovations at any point along the booking until after it has all been finalised.

reviews.title: Aloha!! Well what did you expect?
reviews.text: It shows extremely bad business practise on behalf of the resorts operators and leaves me feeling completely ripped off! I am now looking into cancelling my holiday and finding another location.

reviews.title: Didn't want to leave....
reviews.text: I hope that this can help other travellers before you make the mistake that I have made by booking a holiday to this resort.

Just returned from a weeks stay. Purpose of the trip was to exhibit at a convention on the property. The hotel convention halls were very clean and the staff helped out. Needed extra hangers for my display, called bell desk and bell man brought the hangers right to my booth within 10 minutes. Stayed in a garden view room in the Tapa Tower. Had very good view of the pool. Room was cleaned on a daily basis. In the evening I could hear the nightly entertainment from the balcony outside my room, but when I closed the balcony door I could not hear noise. The food in the convention hall was very good. It was provided by the hotel. Fresh fruit and fresh sandwich wraps. From other reviews on the site I did go to the all you can eat pancakes at the coffee shop across the street. At $5.75 for two eggs, two pieces of bacon and endless pancakes this might be the best deal on the island. Did not have much time for the beach, but I did take a stroll on it and it was very clean. Would go back with my family.
reviews.title: Not bad for a Convention Site

reviews.text: My family wrapped up 11 nights on Maui and Oahu with a two-night stay using Hilton HHonors points.
reviews.title: What You Expect, Minus A Little Aloha

reviews.text: Check-in was relatively brisk, though the bellhop taking our bags out of the car was a bit brusque.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and view were fine, as was the free breakfast we were entitled to. Though this is an immense hotel, it's eminently possible to find places where you're not amidst teeming crowds. Overall, we found the pools, food and amenities to be what we expected or more.
reviews.title: Subpar standards due to buyout this past year!!!! BEWARE!!!!

likes.disliked: — Rooms, and the value of food

reviews.text: The only exception was with the valet parking, which cost $26 a day. It used to be a dollar less, but "for your convenience" added a dollar to include a tip.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

likes.disliked: — no open chairs by the pool

reviews.title: A Little Slice of Heaven
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village from 9/9 to 9/12 and wish we never had to leave.

I cannot think of one bad thing to say about this hotel. We arrived at the airport and had already booked the Oahu Airport Shuttle online to pick us up at the airport. We had to wait about 15 minutes for them to arrive but our driver, William, was very nice and knowledgeable about the city and restaurants. We arrived at the HHV and were treated to the most wonderful guava juice while we waited to be checked in. We originally booked an oceanfront room in the Rainbow Tower and were told that we would be given a room that everyone on our floor dreams of - the corner room. We went to our room and couldn't believe the incredibly beautiful views - you could see all of Waikiki Beach to Diamondhead and the other window had the most beautiful sunsets. We slept so good in the heavenly king size bed and wished we could take it home. The bathroom was supplied with Crabtree & Evelyn bath products.
reviews.title: NOT for rest and relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had bought the Hawaii entertainment book so we ate at the Canton Dragon restaurant and the Village Steak and Seafood Restaurant which gave you buy one get one free dinners. Both restaurants were equally good. We also ate at the Rainbow Lanai one morning for breakfast which is pretty pricy if you don't eat a lot for breakfast - around $20 per person. Our favorite restaurant was Keo's Thai restaurant which is within walking distance of the HHV.
reviews.title: Stunning Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first day after we arrived we just walked along the beach and the shops. The second day we went on an all day tour with E Noa Tours (booked online and used A3H Gold Card which I also purchased online). This tour took us all around the island to the north shore beaches, a buddist temple, waimea beach and botanical gardens, etc. This was an all day tour which was very informative but way too long. I wish we had found a 1/2 day tour. The last day our concierge called Pearl Harbor and the wait was almost 2 hrs so we decided to forgo that activity and hang out on Waikiki Beach. My husband rented a surfboard and I just sat on the beach getting some sun and doing a lot of people watching. After that we walked to the International Shopping Area which was just a bunch of the same kind of junk - don't bother.
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton, here are some tips for you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The last day we ate breakfast and then packed because we were leaving for Maui. I had also booked for Oahu Airport Shuttle to pick us up which I was told was cheaper than a cab. There really is no reason to rent a car because most things are within walking distance or you can take a cheap taxi or go on a tour bus.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: Hotel is great! We stayed here only two nights during April 2006. The hotel grounds are extensive for the Waikiki area. We stayed in the Ali tower and it was a beautiful and luxurious room. We had a great view of the ocean and Diamond head. We would have stayed longer, but the recent sewage problem in Waikiki made us change our plans to go to another island. I would definitely come back here again when the waters clear!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: My family and I had a great stay in the Ali'i towers. Upon check-in, we were escorded to our rooms by the concierge. Both had ocean view and were quite large. The room with the king bed had a love seat and coffee table, the other room with two double beds had a reading chair. The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept in. Better, in my opinion, than the Sheraton Sweet Sleepr, Westin Heavinly Bed, or even the W Bed.
reviews.title: Great stay in Ali'i Towers!

reviews.text: The Ali'i tower provides a more relaxed and private atmosphere. There is a guy in the tower that is free of charge and also a private pool on the 2nd floor. Our rate plan included breakfast at the pool deck. The breakfast was great and the staff there was even better!
reviews.title: Ho-hum
Realy enjoyed it!
reviews.text: The beach directly infront of the hotel seemed crowded, but it opened up a bit down the beach. The water, much like most of Waikiki, is calm and warm. Great for swimming, though don't expect too much snorkeling.

reviews.title: Returning again and looking forward to it
reviews.text: The HHV is in a great location because it is not right on Waikiki but to get to the heart of Waikiki is just a 10 minute walk. Also the Ala Moana shopping center is quite close. Outside of the hotel complex, however, there isn't much in the immediate area.
Honolulu is definitely not the Hawaiian paradise that you see in those nice travel brochures, TV shows and movies.
reviews.title: Nice on the outside but...

likes.disliked: — Too many to list here, but start with the smell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It seems as if the city hasn't really kept up with the times, at least the Waikiki Beach area. Things seem to have gotten stuck at about 1985 here (although there is a lot of new condo apartment construction going up).
reviews.title: Incredible experience

likes.liked: — It's clean, comfortable, with beautiful surroundings, the service is very good, and it's right at the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a perfect example.
reviews.title: Great view, Bali by the sea is great, avoid the other restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Used to be a Diamond Members dream - not any more

likes.liked: — Has nice ocean views and beach access
likes.disliked: — Additional charges for everything you can think of

reviews.title: Had a Great Time
reviews.text: Several large swimming pools - great for families with kids

reviews.title: Hats off to Hilton Hawaiian Village
reviews.text: What a great Hotel! This Hotel has it all. Spent 5 days here recenty and enjoyed it to the max. Stayed in the Ali'i tower. The room was immaculate and full of the amenities you would expect. Great pool, beautiful large beach area, lots of shopping for the ladies, and great restaurants and activities closeby. My kids had a great time also-ocean area perfect for children. What puts this hotel over the top is the atmosphere and service.

reviews.title: Good with children, just okay for adults
reviews.text: Interacted with staff from restaurants, bell service, front desk, activities,

reviews.title: Crass and commercial
reviews.text: doorman etc. -everyone was very friendly and eager to take care of your needs. The only other aspect I would like to mention is the hotel is very busy but the staff handles it well. If you are looking for a secluded getaway this is not the place, but for a family its perfect. One last comment , Hilton does a great job of giving you a resort atmosphere "the village" which is secluded from the city atmosphere which surrounds it. We would return.

Not a bad hotel, but certainly not a great one either. Very reasonably priced and decent, but not spectacular rooms. As with most Hiltons, they could use a few upgrades in the rooms, especially on the bedding, the bathroom, and the carpets throughout the property. And, this is picky I know, but, employees clothing/uniform is severly outdated. Eating in their beautiful restaurant was like being waiting on by Alice in Mel's diner. Still, the staff was pleasant enough - not excellent enough to provoke great tips, but not bad enough to make a complaint.
reviews.title: loved the ali'i tower

reviews.text: But, if you want a great rate and a good place with kids, this works. The Kids club was good, the pool is great and the prices to eat are very reasonable.
reviews.title: Our new home!

reviews.text: A friend recommended this hotel and has stayed there many times. My family including my lother and father in law went here. My in laws had a long walk to the rooms which was ok for us with young kids but not for them. We have a 2 year old and were on the 14th floor so we were very balcony aware. The rooms were kinda small but the views were amazing. The location cannot be beat. The price was high but all in all I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Nice

likes.disliked: — price, long walk to the front of the hotel. Kinda secluded from everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 7 days in July, all I can say is, it's awesome! Go see for yourself and enjoy! There's loads to see and do, the rooms are massive, clean, modern and the staff simply cannot do enough for you. We'll definitely stay there again, yes it's a little bit more expensive than other places for food and drink but a short walk or bus / tram ride - you have everything you want to eat or drink, the shops too are amazing!
reviews.title: Absolute paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got married on the beach in the Kahala district of Honolulu, what a beautiful beach, go there if you want privacy as Waikiki beach can get quite busy. All in all, we found paradise and were sorry we had to leave.
reviews.title: Great Location on Waikiki

likes.disliked: — Room located near service entrance, some noise, high prices at restaurants

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a four night stay July 17 - 20, 2007, at the Hilton Hawaiian Village on Waikiki. (HHV) I would first like to say that the hotel was a wonderful facility with a friendly and helpful staff. (I would be remiss in not mentioning the stellar valet parking staff, first rate)
reviews.title: great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a garden view room in the Diamond Head Tower on the sixth floor. Our view was not much to talk about, but we knew this when we booked our reservation. We were on a budget and did not expect to spend too much time in our room. Our view was of a park on the grounds of the military hotel next door, the Hale Koa. A service entrance was also below our window and there were times when you could hear the sounds coming from the delivery trucks below. This was only during the day, never at night.
reviews.title: Great Resort!

reviews.text: I was truely amazed at this hotel. The staff were amazing! We got a courtesy upgrade when checking in. We were put in the Ali'i tower. We had our own private pool and bar. The lounge chairs were awesome, It is pricey, but we knew that and planned for it. The concierge at the Ali'i Marc was amazing. He helped us save tons of money on excursions! The beds are so comfortable. I do not recommend the Hotels Luau though. It was a waste of money. You need to go to the beach and have a real Luau. Hiltons is on top of a building. Food wasnt that great also. This hotel has wonderful restaurants all inside. We did find a great breakfast place across the street called Wialanies (sp) coffee house. Decent prices. Also, a greek restaurant right down the road was good too. It is about 1/2 mile from the downtown Waikiki area, but walking is not a problem. Its so beautiful it wont seem like any time at all. When we come back to Oahu, we will definantly be staying her again.
reviews.title: Best Hotel around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay. They were late getting our room ready, so they gave us 2 coupon for continental breakfast. The breakfast made up for the minor in-conventions. I read in some reviews that is was crowded; It was busy but I didn't think it was overly so. We always had a place at the pool and beach. We did have to wait 40 min. at the grill/bar. But we sat by the pool while we waited.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: The bed, service, cleanliness was all perfect. Loved the pools! We enjoyed the firework show on the beach. We were on the 3 rd floor so you could hear the band playing until about 11:00 p.m. which didn't bother us but if you turn in earlier get a higher floor. I would stay here again. It was absolutely beautiful.
reviews.title: Not a favorite - would not be back!

reviews.text: Hilton Village Waikiki reminded me of being in NYC - Times Square. Big buidings all around and very busy. We stayed on the property for 7 days. The property is beautiful, with many shops including some high end ones and many vendors around including car rental and tour desks. However, it is not the ideal place to stay or vacation with young children. It was very busy, loud and noisy which gets even louder at nights until after 11 p.m. after the band stops playing. In terms of hospitality, it's the worse I have ever received and I have traveled extensively. We stayed in a family style room in the Tapas building which I tried to change to another building because I did not like looking at the parking lot. The staff refused to change the room unless I paid them a fee even though I told them I could wait a night or two to be changed. Access to the Jacuzzi and gym was in a different building a walks away on the 4th floor. Bar staff only serves you one drink at time and takes forever to come back for your second drink order. Sometimes they even forgotten what drinks we ordered. We couldn't wait to leave.
reviews.title: Back in Hono and at HHawaiian Village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a positive note, our room was cleaned each day and the food in the restaurants were good.
reviews.title: Rainbow Tower meets our expectations:)))

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here with our two college-age children for four nights and loved it! This is a huge resort, but the location right on the beach is great and the grounds are beautiful. We had a room on the 29th floor of the Tapa Tower. Gorgeous view of the beach and ocean! Prepare to spend a lot of money in addition to the room charges. This is a resort in Hawaii, after all. The valet parking people were great - definitely worth the extra few dollars. The restaurants are expensive, but everything is in Hawaii. Try the bar/grille right on the beach in front of the Ali'i Tower for great $10 meals with a view that can't be beat. As a Diamond member, we received vouchers for breakfast for two every morning. The $5 upgrade to a full hot breakfast was worth it. As other reviewers mentioned, don't miss the ABC store for reasonably priced snacks, water ,etc. Be prepared - the area around the hotel is very busy - right in the middle of the city. But the hotel itself is a great oasis. We will definitely stay here again if we return to Waikiki.
reviews.title: Wonderful large resort!

likes.liked: — Right on the beach with gorgeous views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just came back from an 8 night stay (May 10th through the 18th.) We had a fabulous experience from start to finish. The front desk coudn't have been nicer. They upgraded us from a garden view room to an ocean view room on the 11th floor in the Diamond Tower. After reading some of the reviews, I was skeptical when they said they were upgrading us. I was expecting to stand on my lanai and lean way over to be able to see a glimpse of the ocean. When we got to our room, you could see the ocean right as we stepped in. We never once shut our curtains. The view was truly breathtaking. The room was nicely updated, and the beds were very comfy. No charge on the use of our safe, and there was a mini refrigerator to store plenty of water or leftovers. Room service was very kind to us, always careful to leave us a plethora of towels, clean every grain of sand from the carpet, and always smiling and saying hello whenever we passed each other. The room offered free Kona coffee (with Starbucks type cups instead of mugs, so I was able to leave my room with coffee in hand), plus we got free bottled water for being Hilton Honors members. Renting an umbrella and two lounge chairs cost us about $50 (to be expected anywhere you go.) Worth every penny because it felt like paradise in the shade. Plus it prevented the imminent sun burns. We tried the Atlantis submarine tour which departed off the Hilton dock. It was fun and interesting, but I think you're paying for the experience, not for the views. Not as much to see as I would have thought. Go see the King's Jubilee on Friday nights. Tickets are only $12 a person, but it comes with a free drink (yummy pina coladas, mai tais, or blue hawaiians), and you get a great view of the show. It lasts about an hour and has a fireworks show at the end. It doesn't even compare to the show at the Polynesian Cultural Center, but it's definitely fun entertainment. Make sure to utilize the coupon book that the front desk gives you when you check in. It offers a lot of free goodies! Like anywhere else you go on vacation, prices are going to be high in touristy areas. The Wailana Coffee House across the street from the Hilton is cheap, but it's like a Denny's. We got all our cheap snacks and great chocolate (Hawaiian Host) from the ABC store within the village. Most other restaurants were a bit of a walking distance. It took a full half hour at a very brisk pace to make it to dinner at Duke's at the Outrigger. Good way to walk off some of the pounds that you inevitably will gain while in Oahu. Too many desserts to say no to!!! Hilton is a great place to say!
reviews.title: Fabulous Experience

likes.liked: — Front desk personnel were very personable and understanding.
likes.disliked: — Self parking limits you to the 3rd floor and up. Walking up those stairs was not easy, and the elevator was out bit out of the way.

reviews.title: Wedding cake.
reviews.text: In Jan 2006, we decided to get married, and chose The Hilton Hawaiian Village, for our stay. I was a little dissapointed upon check in, to find out that the corner room that i had requested in the raibow tower, was not available, as i had booked the accomodation 14+ months in advance. The staff told me that our party had been upgraded to deluxe sea view rooms, which was false, because that was the room type i had already booked. Also i would have appreciated a little special treatment, as this was a special occasion for us, but didn't recieve any acknowledgement at all. On the day of the wedding, bell service forgot to send the bridal bouquet up to our room, i had to go and collect it myself, not good when you're in a rush. My wife went to the Mandara Spa at the Hilton, for the wedding pack beauty therapy, hair and makeup, and i have to say, they did a great job, well worth the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You could tell, that there has been a lot of effort and money spent on the hotel grounds, ground level was very well manicured, and spotlessly clean, but then again, so was the rest of Waikiki. The room on the other hand failed to live up to the ground level, decent size, very clean, but lacking any character, but the view more than made up for it.
reviews.title: Fantastiv view

likes.disliked: — the confusion over the check-out dates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a great little convenience store in the middle of the site, that sells almost everything you could want while on holiday.
reviews.title: What a Fantastic Facility

likes.disliked: — Beach sand was a bit rocky

reviews.text: Was here for a conference in September. Definitely recommend the check-in at the airport which was a big time saver. I waited in line to use the ATM-like machine for check-in while my husband waited for our luggage. When we got to the hotel (about $30 taxi ride) we skipped a very, very long check-in line.
reviews.title: Nice, if bland hotel

reviews.text: We had a partial ocean view/balcony room in Tapa tower which was a nice size. The crib we requested was not in the room, but after a phone call it was brought very quickly.
reviews.title: LOVED this Hotel!

reviews.text: Pools - the pool at all the towers (except the super pool) are small. More of an issue is that there is no shade at the pool. This was an issue as we were travelling with an infant.
reviews.title: A Good Trip

reviews.text: The hotel restaurants are pricy. We went to both buffets for breakfast (Rainbow Lanai and Tapa Cafe). The Tapa cafe has a nice selection of Japanese foods and Rainbow has an omelette station but otherwise they are pretty boring buffets and not worth the $30+. We also went to CJ's NY style deli, which was fair. It was our first night and we were jet lagged and starving so it suited our needs - but we didn't go back. Round table pizza was fair and slow for lunch. The Kahuna dog at the tapa pool was out of shaved ice for a while one day which was disappointing. Tropics bar & cafe had the best service overall at the lunch we had there.
reviews.title: The best yet in Waikiki

likes.liked: — Spacious with great amenities and seervice

reviews.text: THere are many fancy, overpriced shops in the hotel.
reviews.title: Surprise by how much fun we had; best beach on Waikiki

reviews.text: This property is just beautiful. Our family trip went as planned, we had a fabulous time. This was my 5th trip to this resort but my family's very first time. My husband and 2 daughters, 13 & 8 loved my surprise of a limo and lei greeting, although I was slightly disappointed in the small, carnation lei's that we paid for in advance, and there were no cold drinks in the limo either. Not a good way to start the trip, but they didn't care, so neither did I.
reviews.title: Just As I Remembered! Excellent!

reviews.text: Check-in was very busy but being HHonors member we were able to check in quickly. We had a breathtaking view from our Rainbow Tower Diamond Head 27th floor balcony, unbelievable! That was the closest we have ever been to fireworks, it was like we could reach up and touch them. My kids were in awe.
reviews.title: HHV Has It All!

likes.disliked: — Prices for extra coffee and water.

reviews.text: Yes, food prices are higher than we are used to, but we knew this in advance and along with the Entertainment Book we had no problems. Hey, you're in Hawaii! I figure if you can't afford the food at the resort it's best to stay somewhere else in the first place. Although we dined at just about every restaurant on site, our family favorites were Hatsuhana Japanese Cafe and Lapperts Ice Cream shop, and of course, we spent lots of money at the ABC store. Our last night at Benihana's was so much fun, my daughters loved it and the food was delicious. Our favorite breakfast was the yummy all-you-can-eat banana pancakes with Coconut syrup at Wailana (?) coffee shop across the street from the hotel. The food court at the Ala Moana shopping center has many different types of food and was a great people-watching spot. Speaking of shopping, the Ala Moana is a destination itself. Spent WAY too much moolah there!
reviews.title: Good but what do you expect for the price

likes.liked: — Size of the facilty , beauty of facility
likes.disliked: — Costs are high for almost anything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most fun was the Hawaiian Adventure Water Park, getting belted by the waves at the Bonzai Pipeline, the Dinner Cruise on the Navatek and the Paradise Cove Luau. I had been to this particular luau a few times before, just let me say they have GREATLY improved it. The grounds are cleaner, it seems more organized, but it was so hot we were melting after dark, with no breeze. We happen to be on Oahu during the King K's Celebration so we had a lot of free entertainment, parades, hula competitions, etc...We spent a lot of time at the beach and the Super Pool. My 8 yr old had a blast meeting new friends from all over the world.
reviews.title: Met our expectations
A Great Place To Stay
reviews.text: All in all, everyone at the resort were friendly, service was perfect, weather was perfect, it was a wonderful memory maker for us. We already have reservations for next June, same tower. We wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else.

likes.liked: — Beach activities at Kailua/Lanikai if you're there for the sun/sand. Don't be afraid to ask if there's something you need. Buy water at ABC, they have all your needs there. Check out the bbq lunch take out on Thursdays at Foodland in Hawaii Kai..its awesome. Check out the beach activities at Koko Marina...they are very reasonable and jet skiing was fun!! Have a blast!

reviews.text: We just returned from a 9 day stay at HHV and it was great! We used Hilton Honor points for our stay. Since we are Diamond level Hilton Honors members we were upgraded to a large suite on the 27th floor of the Rainbow Tower with two lanais overlooking the ocean. The view was spectacular! The suite was very large with two full baths which came in handy with the kids. We were also given coupons for a free continental breakfast buffet each day with the option to upgrade to the "full" buffet for $5 more per adult or $3 more per child over 4. This buffet is normally $21.25/adults and $16.50/children. We really felt like they treated their Diamond members well.
reviews.title: Great place for kids!

reviews.text: The grounds at the hotel are just beautiful with waterfalls and ponds. There are all kinds of fish, penguins, flamingos, etc. on the grounds. The kids really enjoyed this.
reviews.title: Love the hotel but eat elsewhere

reviews.text: There are some negatives to this resort. If you are looking for a nice quiet place to stay then this is not for you. It is very busy and crowded. The pool area is very crowded. You can only get a chair by the pool if you get there when the pool opens. We just stayed out on the beach each day instead of fighting the crowd at the pool. The beach area is nice but also got a little crowded at times. The kids didn't mind it though.
reviews.title: Here is the deal...

reviews.text: The hotel is overpriced on a lot of things, but we expected it for Hawaii. The beach umbrella and two chairs cost us $50/day. Valet parking was $19/day - self parking is $16/day. The restaurants are pricey with just average food. We ate most of our meals away from the resort. Bubba Gump' Shrimp in the Ala Moana Shopping Center was our favorite. We did purchase a Hawaii Entertainment Guide for $12.99 before our trip and it had lots of restaurant deals that were great. Most were for buy one get one free meals. There were also lots of deals for most of the attractions. I would hightly recommend this Guide.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Waikiki

likes.disliked: — Some of the amenities that are included in some other hotels are charged for here.

reviews.text: We do plan on returning to this resort in the future because it is a great place for kids.
reviews.title: Not worth it at all!

likes.liked: — The shopping on the hotel property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Hilton Hawaii Village resort for our honeymoon as it look gorgeous in all the brochures. On arrival the Hilton Village ticked all the right boxes, beautiful lobby, wonderful swimming pool, gorgeous gardens, great shops etc etc. However, when we made our way to our room, which was situated on the right hand side of the Rainbow tower, my expectations were clearly too high as I found the communal areas and corridors to be a little bit dated. Our room was pleasant and clean, but it definately felt as though it had seen better days, and the bathroom needed a lick of paint! Overall however, it was a lovely stay, the 30 second stroll to Waikiki beach certainly made up for the disappointing decor and the swimming facilities were fantastic! Eating out wasn't a problem either as you are central to so many things (we decided against eating in one of the many restaurants at the village, as they were quite expensive)!! The experience certainly hasn't put us off Hawaii, but we would think twice about staying at the Hilton.
reviews.title: Needs Updating

reviews.text: The Good the Bad and the Ugly of our Experience

I think we paid US $2,000 (AUD $2,500) for 6 nights. A friend of a friend who works for Mr Hilton had us upgraded before arrival, so i'd be concerned what we would have got had we not been upgrade. You'll see what i mean after you read this.

I went down to Hawaii with my co-workers in 2005 (I know the review is a bit late) and I absolutely loved it. It's clean and very upscale. there is a mini plaza with a Louis vitton store and other small little stores. It has an open concept lobby/check in and it's right on the beach. they have shows every night or other night can't remember and it is a short walk from the main shopping center. Breakfast is super duper expensive. There is a breakfast spot right across from the hotel where you can get a good breakfast for better price. Hawaii is super expensive as it is flooded with tourists.

LOVED IT!!!!!

reviews.text: The local adage "the higher up , the betta" is true. My room was on the 16th floor in the Tapa tower, with an adequate view of the city and partial ocean view. I would say if you are at the 10th floor and lower at any high rise, be prepared to stare into hotel rooms across from you.
reviews.title: Not worth the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was warm and friendly and consistently showed their "Aloha Spirit" from check in, housekeeping , Tapa cafe etc.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Hawaiian Village (HHV) is a huge resort right on Waikiki Beach that does not feel like one. The open air lobby sets the tone -- informal, lush plantings, talking parrot, lots of water splashing in fountains, a view through to the large pool and the Pacific beyond. We arrived late from the mainland and our room was not ready, so they comped us a couple drinks and after 15 minutes led us to room 1203 in the Rainbow Tower. What a suprise -- a fabulous view over Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head that was worth the wait. For folks who normally end up looking at the air conditioners or dumpster, it was a revelation. The room itself was fine -- nice linens, excellent bed, AC worked. The Rainbow Tower is a landmark that is 40 years old, so some of the other towers are much newer, but the location is ideal -- right on the beach, close to the shopping village, lobby and parking structure. HHV is close enough to the rest of Waikiki that a 10-15 minute walk puts you high on the hog in shopping heaven. Our only quibbles were the $15+ per day they charged for internet access and the $20/day they charged for self-parking. We would definitely stay at the HHV again.
reviews.title: Million Dollar View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a seven day trip (Jan. 12-19). What a perfect hotel. We stayed in Rainbow tower, Room 2500 (25 represents the 25th floor). I strongly encourage everyone to stay in the Rainbow Tower. I think it has the best views of all the towers. Rooms ending in 00 or 01 are the corner units facing the ocean. Any odd numbers are great rooms as well, as they face down Waiikiki towards Diamond head. The even rooms face towards downtown, but you still have a partial ocean view. The hotel made this trip. Waikiki is very, very busy beach and Hilton has the best location at the end of the beach. It gives you a very expansive portion of beach (we had plenty of room), unlike other hotels that have literally no, or less than 10 yards of beach. Plus, you can easily walk down to Dukes (overrated in my opinion) or the Royal Hawaaainn (you HAVE to go here for Mai Tai's...simply the best on the island). Also recomend HY's Steak house and Michel's at the colony surf for two of the best dinners i have had. Hy's was one of the best steak places I have been, and it had the best ceasar salad. Table side cooking is great for some items. Michel's is the perfect place to have a 6pm reservation, as you get the sunset. The hotel looks out on the ocean (other end of Waikkiki). Also recomend the hike up Diamond Head, the visit to Pearl Harbor, and a nice drive around the island and visit to the North Shore. We hit diamond head early a.m (7) and it was fine. You have to get to Pearl Harbor early (we got there around 645) to beat the busses which show up b/t 645 and 7. We were back to hotel by 945 and had the whole day. Should get a car so you can drive as you want - we put over 500 miles on it adn still were on the beach everyday. Its great to drive to dinner, and you are not at the mercy of the bus, especially diamond head, pearl harbor, etc... Worth a day trip around the island - spend some time on North Shore (Cholo's mexican was great for lunch) and spend some time at beaches on east/southeastern side of island. Any questions, please feel free to shoot me an email.
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton

reviews.text: We stayed here from 23rd December to 29th December 2007, and WOW!!! what a winter wonderland, the perfect Christmas location!!! The hotel stands on the widest stretch of Waikiki beach in the perfect setting.The resort is huge with many places to eat, and many enticing shops. The large pool has a wonderful bar serving many delicious cocktails with or without alcohol. It can be expensive to eat here every day, but a 10 minute walk brings you to the main stretch along the beach, with many cheaper bars and restaurants.We stayed in the Tapa Tower, with brilliant views of Diamond Head [volcano], and city, and a partial ocean view. The room was huge, as we were upgraded.
reviews.title: Hooray for Hilton

likes.liked: — The sheer beauty of the setting, and excellent hotel facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have a 13 year old daughter who thoroughly enjoyed turtle watching whilst on a pedalo in the amazing clear waters of Waikiki. This hotel really does have it all, and never feels overcrowded as it is so vast.
reviews.title: Ho Hum at the Hilton

likes.liked: — Service and ammenities (front desk, concerige, room service, ice always fresh in ice bucket)
likes.disliked: — Rooms are outdated for the rates

reviews.title: Alii Tower is better but still not up to snuff
reviews.text: Also the people are helpfull and friendly this really added to our enjoyment of our stay here. Checkin is very fast especially if you are a Hilton Honours card member as they have their own checkin desk.

I have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village 3-4 times a year for the past few years. Up until recently it had always been a great hotel due to its location, rooms, and service. Earlier this year changes were noted during a stay at the Kalia Tower, for instance some of the extra bathroom amenities. When asking the maid about it she went onto explain that a change in management had ocurred and there were many cutbacks. Another change was the elimination of the executive lounge that served breakfast and snacks at the Kalia Tower. Another employee that we knew from previous visits confirmed that cost cutting changes had been made by management. On this last visit while staying at the Alii Tower requests were made to change the sheets using the "change the sheets request card" located on the night stand. Each time the card was put out on the bed the sheets were not changed. There was a stain in the top left corner of the sheets and each time we came back to the room it was evident the sheets had not been replaced as requested. Upon entering the room hair from the previous guest was found in the bathtub and toilet area. Not sure if the maids just have too many rooms to clean now and need to cut corners to keep up.
reviews.title: Not the same due to a change in management

likes.liked: — easy access to major businesses, location away from the Waikiki madness
likes.disliked: — Like other reviews it can be very difficult to find a chair near the pool and they are packed together. Maid service is starting to go down, restaurants are expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely return to the hotel but hope these little things are corrected.
reviews.title: dont waste your money on Hawaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel property is nice, rooms are ok but the service is HORRIBLE. Everyone here is rude and unfriendly. We travel alot and are extremely disappointed by our first trip to Hawaii. There is no schedule for when restaurants and bars open. If you ask an employee a question they seem annoyed. We called room service to order a pizza and we were told we could not order pizza (even though it was on the menu) because it was raining so they could not guarantee that our order would correct when it arrived. WHAT? Are we on candid camera here? Taxi drivers wont even acknowledge female customers unless a man is present. No wonder the economy is bad here. The only people that come are the ones that dont know there are much better places to visit. Save your money and the long flight. Go to the bahamas instead. They treat you much better and are happy that you are there to visit!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Great Views-

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights. Checked in on 11/28 and departed on 12/02. This place is huge. We took a shuttle from the airport. Other reviews were right. It is a LONG walk from the airport shuttle drop off area to the front desk. My husband and I got our luggage together and started walking - THEN one of the bellmen at the shuttle drop off asked if we needed help. We declined.....
reviews.title: paradise hotel!

likes.liked: — sea view and access to the beach
likes.disliked: — check out was a bit slow but not too bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was easy - I am Gold and my husband is Diamond Hilton Honors so we had a quick check in; however, there was a long line to check in if you weren't. Our room was on the 35th floor in the Tapa Tower. We had a beautiful ocean view. We got a free continental breakfast each morning. We enjoyed that perk. The servers in the breakfast restaurant were very prompt and friendly. We did the time share presentation and was given a voucher for the hotel. We opted to use the voucher (+ a few more $$$) to get a couples massage in the spa. The spa is nice with steam sauna, hot tubs, etc. the massage was great!!! The rooms were large and the beds were very comfortable. Walls were a bit thin and we could hear our neighbors next door.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Alii Tower at the HHV from 16 - 26 November 2005. The whole complex is an eye-opener; it's huge, although having the different towers tends to reduce the impersonality that comes with its sheer size. The garden and the wildlife is a wonderful touch providing a peaceful haven at the centre of this massive and busy complex.
reviews.title: Loved paradise by the sea
All Around Good
reviews.text: The HHV is ideally situated for our purpose, far enough from the noise of Waikiki's centre but near enough to be able to walk to the hustle and bustle when we wanted to. The walk from the Alii Tower front door along the beach towards Diamond Head was very pleasant.

It's location on the wider part of Waikiki beach is ideal although we tended to stay around the exclusive Alii Tower pool rather than venture onto the sand. The towel service and the mini gym located around the exclusive pool is worth the additional cost of staying at the Alii alone but add this to the pool bar waitress service, free nibbles at 5-6 o clock and the fantastic sunset views from the terrace its definitely worth the extra.
reviews.title: A Great Property
Loved the Hilton!
reviews.text: The Alii Tower rooms are very comfortable and of reasonable size, with regular maid service, at least three times a day, ending with a chocolate turn down at bedtime. We were upgraded from a garden view room to a part ocean view room overlooking the ‘super pool’ although I must confess the use of the word ‘super’ is using a bit of poetic licence. Room tea, coffee and water are also free at the Alii. From the lanai we could watch the Friday night performance of traditional Hawaiian music and dance and later on the firework display that lit up the night sky.

We tended to move around Waikiki restaurants for our evening meals but did experience wonderful dinners at the Golden Dragon and Bali By the Sea restaurants; the latter on Thanksgiving evening was superb, expensive yes but still superb - worth every penny. Other recommendations would be The American Cheesecake Factory and Ruth Chris’ Steakhouse.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel!!

reviews.text: We spent one night in the Ali'i tower in September 05. We had to call the front desk for services that were supposed to be automatically provided (fresh fruit, water, and turndown service). The room was nice and had a very good view from the balcony; but was not extravagent for the VIP tower. There was nothing horribly wrong with this resort; but nothing stood out either. That is a problem for an expensive, top of the lne resort. We would not return or recommend this to any friend or family member.
reviews.title: Not worth price

reviews.text: We loved this place but the will nickle and dime you to death. The view we had was great. the room was great and it had a mini fridge in the room. Make sure you bring your own coffee or every time you make coffe its $4.00 We did order some sodas at the bar by the pool for $8.25 I was shocked and the pool closes at 6 pm and you do have to pay for the chairs on the beach parking is $15 a day which is not too bad they do have some nice stores in the village and a shipping store on the complex. the only other complaint I do have is its just soo big its alot of people there but do stay anywhere else in Honolulu just bring your wallet for here.
reviews.title: rainbow tower
Not worth the stay
reviews.text: We relocated to Oahu from the mainland in April 2005. We stayed at the hotel until our house closed on July 23, 2005 - oh we paid for 2 rooms that entire time SO THINK OF THE MONEY WE WERE DROPPING INCLUDING FOOD 3 MEALS A DAY TIMES 3 PEOPLE. WHAT A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. We never got maid service daily if we were lucky everyother day. I was walking to our building one day when the gentlemen who opens the door stood next to the door and jokingly i asked if he was going to open the door, he stated "NO YOU ARE LUCKY ENOUGH TO HAVE A BED" Our facet in our bathroom leaked nonstop we called the front desk 4 times. Finally a manager called me on my cell phone to state he "was personally in your room" to fix the problem...I went up there to our room within 2 minutes and guess what - no one was there. I called him back and he stated he was there and it was fixed. It was not. he lied. When we went to the restaurants on the property and they asked what room we are staying at, if we told them the room number, they would put us on a "wait" list and then seat us in the worse location of the resort. After awhile - we wised up and gave them FAKE names and stated we were not staying at the hotel - WORLD CLASS SERVICE! We took these issues and many more to the GM, Asst GM and ANY MANAGER THAT WOULD LISTEN. The problems and lack of service fell on deaf ears. We paid over $20,000 to stay there for that time period and we got nothing but lack of concern. Our daughters rooms air conditioner was broken the entire time, we asked for it to be fixed....NOTHING. We could not change hotels because of the length of time we required no one else could take us for that long. Finally my sps wrote a letter to the Beverly HIlls Corp Office.... They forwarded the complaint onto the SAME GM as before. The GM called my sps assured him that this was not usual service (we disagree because get this) The GM personally stated he would give us a weekend free at the hotel. (ok fine) and he personally stated he would get us out all the paper work immediately - THAT WAS 3 WEEKS AGO. HE HAS NEVER RETURNED OUR PH CALLS OR HAVE WE RECIEVED THE FREE WEEKEND!

reviews.title: ok - overrated for the service provided
reviews.text: THE LIST OF COMPLAINTS GO ON AND ON. I AM JUST TRYING TO LIST THE ONES THAT STAND OUT IN MY MIND. I TRIED TO CUT AND PASTE THE letter my sps wrote to beverly hills and It would not cooperate.
We stayed at HHV from 8/30 - 9/7/05. We didn't like it much and would not come back again for a variety of reasons:
reviews.title: Best Overall Honolulu Hotel/Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We saw a couple of negative reviews about The Village, but we had a great stay. My wife and I were there for ten nights and found the staff very friendly and always eager to help. Restaurant and bar staff were really good and knew our drinks after a couple of days. The room was a partial ocean view on the 20th floor of the Tapa Tower......very nice and maid service was always efficient. Remember to tip and you'll have a good time where-ever you go, but we can definitely reccomend this large resort for its friendly ambiance. One other tip to having a good time, "If you're stern-faced and not too pleasant, dont expect good service.....anywhere.
reviews.title: Becomes a favorite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has such a great view of the entire Waikiki stretch. We had a beautiful view of Diamond Head Crater. Hilton had their own lagoon and breakwater which made it easy to swim and had fish near the breakwater.
reviews.title: Hawaiian Paradise

reviews.text: Shops, restaurants, even ABC are just within the village. It is walking distance to everything - International Market to McDonald's. There's even a Walmart/Sam's Club w/in driving distance.
reviews.title: Great family hotel

reviews.text: Parking is $30 per night so watch out! Valet personnel are all so personable and helpful so they're worth it!
reviews.title: Wonderful location, but staff makes this a miserable place to stay
Still one of my favorites...Wonderful but..
reviews.text: We stayed at the HHV for one week in March.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want lots of action, nightlife and shopping this is a great spot. Waikiki isn't a good Hawaii beach. It is dirty, very crowded and the water is cloudy. If you want excellent shopping and chain restaurants than this is the place. Besides that I'd say go to the Hilton on the Big Island for pristine beaches, great snorkeling, Hawaiian culture and endless outdoor activities.
reviews.title: Crazy busy place.

likes.liked: — too crowded, bad beach and pool too busy

reviews.text: For us, this hotel is the best-placed in Waikiki. The beach has ample sand, the lagoon is fantastic, the bus-stop is opposite and the resort's amenities are plentiful. the shops and restaurants of Waikiki are a 5-minute walk and the shopping mecca of Ala Moana is a five - ten minute bus-ride ($2). We changed rooms during our stay and were upgraded to a full beach-view room in the Tapa tower .. and the view WAS beautiful. The negatives? Like a previous reviewer, we were without power for the night and had no torches in our room. The hotel restaurants and shops are VERY expensive (look outside the hotel's ABC shops and you will see a big difference) and the quality of food at the poolside cafes is actually poor and very costly - $US5 for a plate of corn chips microwaved with liquid cheese poured over - revolting.
reviews.title: A great spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eat and shop outside the hotel and you will love the Hilton!
reviews.title: diasppointed Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a Hilton Honors and Hiltion Grand Vacation Club owner
reviews.title: Everything you need in the heart of Waikiki

likes.liked: — The grounds are beyond beautiful and beachfront location

reviews.text: Hilton prides itself on tremendous hospitality. Every other Hilton hotel I have stayed at gave great service and was most accommodating. Internet always FREE.
reviews.title: It's gotten cheaper -- in more ways than one

likes.disliked: — Deteriorating service over what it was in prior years.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is huge!!! Only one of two resorts actually located with beachfront property (Sheraton was the only other one I saw on the beach...everything else seemed to be across the street).
reviews.title: Great resort!!!

likes.disliked: — Not much of an ocean view from my ocean view room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the 34th floor of the Tapa Tower. We booked a ocean view and that was about it...a view...mostly city. Had to go to the far corner of the lanai to see the ocen or view it from inside the room out another window.
reviews.title: Hugh Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Huge room, kind of laid out strangely but really spacious with a bar space and dressing area outside the bathroom.
reviews.title: Reliable hotel, great ammenities

likes.liked: — The shopping was nice to have right there. Being off the main part of Waikiki beach was nice.
likes.disliked: — Main pool area is beautiful but gets crowded early in the day. It is a large hotel so there are always people everywhere.

reviews.text: Room service was tasty and prompt.
reviews.title: Peaceful, friendly, welcoming, and SO SO SO warm!

likes.liked: — complimentary room after check out, but prior to flight

reviews.text: More people than I would have liked to have seen in one area unlike our stay in Maui, but that is no fault of the hotel...the entire Waikiki Beach area is way overcrowded anyways. The Hilton Villiage is a little further away from the rest of the big crowds and is less rowdy, although it was hard to get onto the beach due to the number of people on the grounds.
reviews.title: Ali'i Tower much superior, Diamond head nothing special

likes.disliked: — Diamond Head- old; food-blah and expensive.

reviews.text: My wife and daughter recently spent 2 nights at this Hilton. We stayed based on comments from Trip Advisor. It was very nice, but also very large and very busy. This was a bit of culture shock after staying on Kauai for a week in a condo. Despite it's size they are very organized. Our room was immaculate. The maid service was adequate. I agree with others about the expense of eating in and around the hotel area. We did have a very nice and inexpensive meal at the Noodle House in the village and the pizza at the Round Table was very good and not overly priced. The beach and and pool areas were very nice, but also very crowded. We also saw the fireworks from the beach on July 4th and they were excellent. One thing I would do different in the future is not to arrive until at least 3 PM because it is very unlikely you will be able to check into your room prior to 3 PM. Overall the hotel was excellent and there is certainly a lot to do in the area.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: We stayed only one night after staying on Maui and loved it. The hotel was expensive but we were on the waikiki side on a high floor and the view was incredible. Worth it!
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.text: My husband and I arrived feeling somewhat jaded from Brisbane and had to queue for quite some time to check in to the hotel. We spent 3 nights in the HHV from 11 to 14 June 2005 and stayed in the Tapa Tower. Our room was very good indeed, spotless and comfortable. It was also very quiet and no sign of screaming children. The gardens were absolutely lovely and we were just happy to be able to relax there before moving on to our next destination in the US. Yes, there are expensive boutiques and restaurants but there are other reasonable places too. We thought the runner holding a flaming torch and lighting the streetlights very effective - we admired his stamina! All in all, we had a very relaxing time and would quite definitely return to the HHV and specifically the Tapa Tower.
reviews.title: What a lovely place
AWESOME!AWESOME!AWESOME!
reviews.text: We stayed here for our honeymoon. We were totally impressed. The grounds are BEAUTIFUL! Parrots, ducks, pengiuns, fish all around. Right on the beach. We had awesome views of the ocean and Diamond Head from our room. And the super pool was nice.We stayed in the Rainbow tower. We highly recommend this place. This resort has everything you'll ever need. Really there is no reason to leave this paradise and venture out into the people packed streets. They had great stores to shop in. I am a shopper! The only thing we didn't like was the Chinese restuarant on premise.

reviews.title: Wonderful view
reviews.text: Highly recommend this resort!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in the Rainbow Tower. Our room had an ocean view. The room was beautifully decorated. The weather was gorgeous and sunny. It is a full-service property. I was tired and was there to relax. I loved the fact that I didn't need to leave the property for anything. The property is lushly landscaped. You feel like you are in a tropical garden. There are palm trees, waterfalls, tropical fish, turtles, penguins, birds, etc. There are several pools. The main pool is the Super Pool.
reviews.title: Great stay! Beautiful hotel! Beautiful location!

reviews.text: We had a balcony and basically slept with the doors open, because we loved it so much. We had the breakfast buffet each morning downstairs in the Rainbow Tower. My husband is a Hilton Honors club member; hence we received a great discount on the price of the breakfast buffet. We also had lunch and dinner at the property (Hanajuban Noodle Shop, CJ's New York Style Delicatessen, Lappert's Ice Cream, Tropics Bar and Beach Café). Some of the restaurants have Early Dinner Specials (i.e. Benahana). We spent each day on the beach or exploring the property. We did venture down the beach to the Outrigger Reef Hotel to have dinner at the Shorebird one night. We remembered it from a previous visit to Waikiki and enjoyed it.
reviews.title: For the business traveler overpriced, noisy, and crowded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my next stay, I plan to spend several hours (if not an entire day) at the Ala Moana Shopping Center.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful 25th anniversary trip
Don't stay here if you want to get away from it all!
reviews.text: I am a Hilton Diamond HHonors member and recently stayed in the Ali'i Tower on a business trip to Honolulu as I have for over ten years. Sadly, I plan to not return to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, but shift to the Hilton Prince Kuhio.

For the rates one is charged to stay in the Ali'i Tower - presumably the best lodging offered, one would expect a higher level of guest service and certainly a better stay experience. Unfortunately, both were lacking from the time I checked in right through my stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful, but just not for me

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Aug 25th - Sept 01 in the Alii tower partial ocean view. What an experience we had. Let me first start by commending the entire staff on the Hilton grounds to include all of the shops and restaurants that we visited. This resort is enormous. The room was beautiful and we felt so spoiled.We had turn down service 3 times a day with chocolates and a flower on our pillows. The pools were great. I am glad though that we had a private pool at the Alii tower because the main pool was very crowded. Everyone we ran into that worked at the HHV (Hilton Hawaiian Village) seemed to be very happy to be employed there. They keep this resort in ship shape. The most beautiful grounds we have ever seen. Great entertainment at the bars nightly. Excellent service and very attentive staff. Overall we have to say that this was by far the most enjoyable place we have ever stayed at. We will be back in the near future!
reviews.title: The best of the best

reviews.text: We spent one afternoon on the last day of our two week dream vacation @ HHV. The last nights were spent in Waikiki, at the Outrigger on the beach. Check in was fast, service good, nice rooms and grounds @HHV. It is just to big, to many towers and to busy, this hotel had the most crowded pool(S), beach and everything else. It's not a bad place, but if you want to relax and need some space, stay away from the HHV.
reviews.title: To Big

reviews.text: We visited Maui prior to Oahu and found the islands to be as different as night and day. We enjoyed our experience on both islands but prefer Maui. Honolulu is a very large city with lots of traffic and Waikiki is crowded. We did find, however, that the beach at the Hilton Hawaiian Villiage to be more spacious and less crowded than the other hotels and resorts along the Waikiki beach. The beach is also lit up at night which was nice to view from the lanai or take a walk. Many of the other resorts and hotels have a very narrow beach if any. If being on the beach in the hustle and bustle of a big city is for you than I would definately recommend the HHV. The grounds of the resort are beautiful with places to shop and eat. We did eat at one restaurants in the Rainbow Tower. It was an upscale gormet restaurant and the food was presented beautifully and tasted delicous. The service was excellent. It was expensive but worth the price. We ate most of our meals outside the resort and enjoyed Bubba Gump's at the Mall nearby. Our room was in the Alli Tower and we were upgraded to Ocean Front. It was a very spacious room and quite comfortable. The bathroom had three sections and two sinks plus a tv on the vanity. It also had a large closet. We loved our room there and the view was fantastic. The people at the hotel were nice but seemed a bit too serious compared to the warm and friendly employees we encountered at the resort we stayed at in Maui. The entry drive into the resort was in the center of the complex which didn't make sense to me since people were constantly crossing which made it a little annoying when entering or leaving. Once you manuever your way thru the main drive the parking deck was convenient and had ample spaces. I would highly recommend the HHV Alii Tower and would stay there again if I were to visit Honolulu. I also recommend renting a car and driving along the coast to the northshore and thru the mountains. It is quite beautiful there. The luau at Paradise Cove was excellent too.
reviews.title: a little paradise in a crowded city

reviews.text: OK-1st of all, I want to thank the many reviewers on this site for the tips provided about this hotel. That was the main reason I was prepared for what others considered surprising. We arrived Aug 31 2005 and stayed till Sept 5 2005. We were in the Tapa Tower on the 13th floor. 1st let me point out that I have never heard of a hotel in the U.S. having a 13th floor-and every time we got into the elevator and pressed our floor -people always had a comment. However, it was the beginning of a great trip-with no bad luck whatsoever! Our room was of average size and although we booked a village garden view room to save some money-we had a great view on all sides (to the right was a park w/a lot of greenery, front view of Honolulu city, to the left a lovely ocean view) definately more than we bargained for. Also, the Tapa tower in convienently located with the Tapa pool right downstairs, the Tapa bar next to it with nightly entertainment, and the beach not too far away. There were no funny or moldy smells, the AC worked fine, and the beds are the most amazingly comfortable I have ever slept on. The room was cleaned every day, we had plenty of towels, and the sheets are changed only if you put the sign on the bed letting the maids know you want the sheets changed. Definately go to the ABC store, (the one across from the hotel, around the corner from Wailana Coffee House is a little cheaper than the one in the village, but either one is fine) and buy your coffee/filters/tea/sodas/water/snacks/etc. It is indeed outrageous that the hotel would charge for in room coffee (and so much!) especially since you can get it at the ABC store and make it yourself with the in room coffee pot. Other tips: Wailana Coffee House across from hotel for breakfast (from 4.99 to 9.00) lunch and even dinner. Germaine's Luau-below average food, but great show. Book the Pearl Harbor/Circle Island tour thru E'noa Tours w/the American Express Tours/activities desk next to the check in counter with Kit or Julie. An all day tour but worth it! Pearl Harbor, and short stops at Dole Plantation, and a macadamia nut farm, and you see the entire island-great photo ops. Also Round Table Pizza in the Village is reasonable and good.
reviews.title: Had a great time!!

reviews.text: Yes, the pools are shallow- I guess ti limit their liability from people diving -the super pool is only 3 1/2 feet and the Tapa pool 4 1/2 ft. But they are clean and temperature perfect. You want deep? There's a whole ocean a few feet away! And talk about warm water-the ocean is a great big bath (75 to 78 degree water). I came for both a convention and a small vacation, and I was expecting a disneyland-in-California-in-July-like atmosphere, but it just wasn't like that. It was hardly crowded at all-even wth the conventioners in town (about 8500 people, in different hotels of course) along with the usual guests/tourists. Maybe it was the time period in which we went. My son did miss a couple days of school. So I guess this would be a good time to go-after everyone else's vacation time. So we are planning to return here in 2007 but staying at least 7 days. Also if you are in Southern California, I recommend flying Aloha Airlines-they have a non stop flight and they serve food. That way you save on travel time.
reviews.title: Not so good...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Honolulu during a week in July 2008.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon...

likes.liked: — The location, the environnement, the beach,..
likes.disliked: — staff was not very friendly; not enough space around the pools, which are too small for the entire resort !

reviews.text: Overall, the stay was amazing, especially with the beautiful island. Oahu is really great and there are so many wonderful things to see; to visit, to discover,...
reviews.title: If you are a nitpick, then don't travel. This place is cool.

likes.liked: — The Village, the grounds and the views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple

So, it was quite nice to have an Ocean View Room, we had an amazing view. nothing special in the room but nicely decorated and the bed is great. Only dissapointed by the bathroom, very small, old, and not really a "Hilton" value.
