reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Regarding the resort : the resort was overall very nice, great gardens and beautifully "decorated". There were pinguins, fish, a lot of animals to discover while walking through the resort.
reviews.title: Not as good as it could be

reviews.text: Negative point was about the swimming pools... they are way too small with all the folks around ! We almost never get a place, and enjoyed very little the pools. I guess it's not the best place for the swimming pools... But the beach was great ! I think it's the best part of the waikiki beach. Very large, not that many people, and great water ! You have an amzing view on DIamond Head and can have a great walk along Waikiki Beach.
reviews.title: paradise in the pacific

likes.liked: — The massive suite and the atmosphere with friendly staff everywhere
likes.disliked: — I got dizzy looking over the balcony!

reviews.text: We just recently got back from our Hawaiian vacation. We stayed at the HHV because it was a work thing for me husband. I'm usually not a big fan of the chain type of hotels but we really had a good experience here. The grounds are kept up very well and it's really very clean. Our rooms were in the Tapa Tower and while they could use some renovations the view of Diamondback Mountain and the ocean were not to be beat. The beds were comfy and sheets of good quality. I would say overall our rooms were pretty clean (although a little Windex would go a long way on the windows/doors but that's a minor quibble). The beach area is beautiful. It is quite expensive to rent chairs and an umbrella for the day but we usually did to be a little more comfortable. We didn't use the pool very often since the ocean was pretty calm and we felt comfortable being in the water there. I will say that the food was pretty awful in our experience. I would get off property as much as possible. It's expensive and truly bad. We walked down to the Royal Hawaiian one night along the beach and we thought the HHV beach was by far the nicest and least busy.
reviews.title: Nice stay at HHV

reviews.text: Our family stayed 2 nights post a 7-day cruise. We were given a Big, clean room with city view. Well-kept grounds. Many restaurants and stores right on the property. Staff, management VERY friendly. Nice beach, but had too many rocks in the sand. Convenient transportation area to get a taxi or shuttle bus.
reviews.title: nice, HUGE resprt

likes.disliked: — the construction going on the property

reviews.text: We stayed two days at the Hilton Hawiian Village during our trip to Hawaii. Unfortunately I was very sick one of the days so I ended up staying in the room for the entire day, but the little that I saw of the resort, I was very impressed. The grounds are impeccable. The hotel is located on a beautiful beach. The pool is beautiful. Staying at the Hilton is almost like staying in a small village as there is shopping right on the premisis. The beds are very comfortable with down bedding and pillows.
reviews.title: Gorgeous grounds!!!

likes.liked: — The grounds were stunning and the beach was very nice.
likes.disliked: — A bit of a walk to the main attractions in Waikiki.

reviews.text: We booked the Ilikai tower. The entry way is marble and there is a doorman. The room was very nice and had a marble bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Hotel to stay at, but eat elsewhere.

reviews.text: I would hightly recommend staying at this hotel. It is everything that you would want for a vacation. We will return.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 9 nights, including July 4th, and had a fantastic stay. The fireworks show was perhaps the best we'd ever seen, and we viewed it from the comfort of our room! Our package deal included a 'garden view' room but upon arrival, we had been magically upgraded to an ocean view room. It was in the Kalia tower, which is kind of new. It is the farthest one back from the beach, but it still had a great view of the water. It was a comfortable room and included a little refrigerator (in addition to a mini bar) so all the drinks I bought at ABC had a cool home. The grounds are beautiful to see, as there are planters, flower beds, koi ponds, penguins, parrots, and plenty flora and fauna that are entertaining. There are lots of stores, though most are jewelry and touristy-souvenir types. There are several restaurants, and none is particularly budget-friendly, but all we tried were tasty. One bad experience was at the Golden Dragon. We have been to the one at the Vegas Hilton and it was a great experience, but this one, with one bad waiter, ruined the meal. He had to argue with my husband about how and what he wanted to order and rushed us because the kitchen was closing. We got the manager and a new waiter, then all was well.
reviews.title: Great resort in paradise!

reviews.text: Having shuttle pickup outside the Tapa tower was very convenient. We had a car and used the parking garage too, but traffic can be terrible at times and we didn't know where we were going so shuttles to the luau and dinner cruise were welcome.
reviews.title: Would not return
Loved the Hilton
reviews.text: We also took a shuttle to Hilo Hattie, which is an awesome store for Hawaiian clothing and gifts, but the Hilton was the first stop so we got to go all through town to pick up other people. It made me appreciate the Hilton, because once you get into 'hotel row' it is so crowded with walking tourists (who don't know what the "red hand-don't walk" sign means) it is very hard to drive through. The Hilton is more isolated, although there are plenty things in walking distance too. Cabs are handy to get you to the crowded places without having to fight for parking. Many of the cabs are Town Cars, which are very nice! The giant Ala Moana mall is pretty close too, and it is pretty easy to get a shuttle to or from there. There is a huge food court, and lots of high-end stores.
The Super Pool was not as cool in person as in pictures, and always had a crowd, but was pretty and well-serviced.
reviews.title: The glowing reviews baffle me...
Perfect Vacation
reviews.text: We very much enjoyed our stay here and definitely would choose it again and recommend it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved our room on the hotel's website and got a great rate for our Alii Tower room. Normally we stay at the Kahala Mandarin but this time we wanted to experience life at the other end of Waikiki. Basically we liked it better because it closer to all the action and it's not crammed between other high rises. It feels like a real resort. Service was first class and our room was spacious, light and quiet. The new lagoon facing the beach was inviting to look but we ended up walking down to the surfing area for the true Waikiki experience. Alamo rental cars was offering such a sweet deal we booked a midsize for three days. We had two guidebooks, the Eyewitness and Oahu Trailblazer. Trailblazer was a better reference and had all the driving directions. First day we drove up the East Side and were astonished to see cliffs and beaches that looked like Tahiti. We rented kayaks and paddled out to Goat Island for a picnic. Another day we spent the whole day on the North Shore and golfed at Turtle Bay Resort which sits out on a point and was windy. Both of us used the Hilton Spa and had lomi lomi massages. We plan to stay at the Hilton on Kauai next fall and hope it will be as great.
reviews.title: We splurged!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned to Canada and miss the surf and beach at the Hilton already. I am writing this review because I research trip advisor routinely for all the trips that we take and I find the reviews informative. I always evaluate the tips and use the information at our destinations to find the best excursion, restaurants, shopping, etc. Hope this review assists you in making your decision about the Hilton in Oahu.
reviews.title: Can"t Wait to Go Back

likes.liked: — location, wildlife and flowers on site, entertainment, friendly staff and tour options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel complex is massive and amazing. We were truly delighted to be there and enjoyed the facility. STaff are friendly, helpful, and there is a lot to enjoy. The problem is cramming everything in before you have to return home. We loved the exotic wildlife, the waterfalls, the shopping, the floral gardens, the entertainment that is on site.and the tours that were arranged for us by the staff. In addition, great location to take city busses, or walk to Waikki beach. The bus stop is just out front of the property. We used the tour desk on site to book tours and they were excellent. We went to the Arizonza Memorial 4 hour tour which gave us a tour of the city and the Punchbowl Cemetary. Tour guides were friendly and informative. If you have the opportunity go with cousin Paul, he was amazing with the ALoha tour group. ,Did the whale watching tour with ATlantis which included the lunch. It was OK. if you have not seen whales before. We have ,so it was not a huge exciting trip but well worth it for 62 dollars each which included a nice buffet lunch. Kids on board loved the action and we enjoyed the view of the hotels from the water. Whale sitings are guarenteed or your money is returned. Also rented a convertable to tour the entire island on one day, and that was amazing to say the least. DO IT and you will not regret signing up for a bus tour . We stopped many times, saw the whales, the surfers on the north shore, Visited the pine apple plant, a few bars and some shopping along the way completed the day. Having our own transportation made it so easy to pick and choose where we wanted to stop and sight see and how long we wanted to stay at one particular spot was up to us and not a tour operator. Car cost 55 dollars with Hertz for 24 hours and we booked it on site. It was a deal for the day because we took it as is, and not cleaned. It was still emaculate and ready to go, with our bathing suits packed and a few snacks we were on our way. What a day!
reviews.title: Good pre-cruise hotel

likes.liked: — Quietness, closeness to beach, access to private pool

reviews.text: WEather was fantastic, lots of sun by the pool and beach, and lots of entertainment to choose from. The tropic bar was our pick every day from 3 p.m.on into early evening. Local talent was great. The Friday evening show was exceptional, the lei making classes were fun, we even did the timeshare tour and were not hassled when we declined. Check out the deal if you sign up. It worked really well for us. HIgh end and low end shopping if you want is within walking distance and particularly at night along Lewers street is fun. Hotel room was very large complete with alll the amenities you could wish for. If you needed anything extra just ask and you shall receive immediately. Be patient with housekeeping if you want your room cleaned before noon, as it is a large facility but it always get done.Being Canadians we took our own TIm HOrtons coffee and filters and it worked each morning for us on our balcony. We quickly figured out how to make a two cup individual cup coffee maker work to our advantage. The hotel supplies individual cup servings of Kona coffee that just don't cut it when we are used to our own Tims Brew. If you choose there is a STar Bucks on site in one of the buildings that on some days we went to just to sit by the many waterfall areas. What a way to enjoy a cup of coffee. We stayed in the Diamond Head building overlooking the garden and one of the five pools. It was great. WAlked every morning along the beach with our coffee thermos cups and watched the most incredible sunrises and sunsets in the evening were even more breathtaking. The beach front is unparalled by any other hotel along the strip. It is clean, safe ( police regularly patrolling) and groomed each morning for a new day.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous Time!

likes.liked: — My seven month old grandest-son had a blast.

reviews.text: Ladies, dress is from casual to very upscale. REstaurants are the same so be prepared. SHopping on site is very expensive for clothing, just as are all Hilton sites tend to be.THe ABC store on site , however offered reasonably priced food to go, liquor, souveniers, etc. WE used the coupon books to our advantage and you receive those upon check in. EAting on site is expensive but you can modify. Yogurt, bananas, sandwiches in our mini fridge worked for lite meals and snacks. We often shared a breakfast at the restaurant kiddy corner to the resort in the mornings and we were happy campers. Servings are large and prices are less than half you would pay on site. On site the Brfst buffet starts at 17 US, coffee is 4 US, alcoholic drinks are always 10 US or more. Many late afternoons we shared tacos for two at the Tropic BAr for 10 US and we loved it as we listened to the entertainment. Take along a thermos cup and fill it from your room if you wish or during the day take a cooler bag and ice to where you wish to enjoy the sun, beach and or pool . It is a tip I picked up on trip advisor and used a lot during our stay. Room service ....... well we were tired after a 17 hour treck through the sky from Canada, so we did it because we knew what jet lag was going to do to us in the next few hours.Two sandwiches with water only were 54 US. Be prepared for that. Dinner for two at the restaurants will be 150 t0 200 US, without alcohol. You can eat off site very well and inexpensively if you look. for it in the main district along Kalia street and Kelawana street.. Happy hours work with half price appetisers too! Don't let the high cost of meals deter you from this hotel. It is well worth it to stay there and eat off site. Our visit to Oahu was fantastic because we stayed there and explored the island at our pace using what the hotel could offer us for enjoyment, relaxation, car rentals and tours. You won't be disappointed, so enjoy your vacation. We will definately return and would recommend this hotel to any age group.
reviews.title: Great View, Clean Rooms, Great Staff
Great hotel, room and beach
reviews.text: We stayed in the Ali'i tower 3rd floor with partial ocean view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Enjoyed our honeymoon at the Hilton Hawaiian Village!

likes.liked: — Environment, beautiful grounds and wildlife, pretty beach, good restaurants, convenient location
likes.disliked: — Crowded main pool, needing to rent beach chairs, Lagoon was closed (construction)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room over looks a beautiful public park and partial view of the ocean. The room itself was very clean, the beds had nice crisp sheets with mattresses that were vey close to my own. The room really was great, no complaints at all. The maids cleaned just enough not to disrupt your personal belongings. There is a outdoor pool, hot tub, exercise room and a lounging area on the second floor of the tower. Free appatizers every night between 5-7pm(finger food). There is a couple of large pools outside at ground level with a huge lounging area as well. The beach directly out front is kinda busy, but if you walk a couple hundred feet it turns to a public beach which is not as busy. The sand is nice and not too much coral or other obstacles to walk over. Take a stroll down the public beach and hit a food stand under the first condo/hotel called Wakiki Pizzaria? ( I think) Great food and good value. Subway is also there and a few other good ones. The hotel and grounds are on it's own at one end of Wakikii beach so it is definetly much quieter than all the rest that are side by side. You can walk or take a city bus practically anywhere on the island. If you walk to the International Market don't buy the first thing you see because, almost every vendor sells the exact same thing and some do barter very very low. My wife and I felt very safe every where we went.
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort! Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives:
reviews.title: Fabulous Time at The Hawaiian Hilton Village

likes.disliked: — Having to leave it to return home.

reviews.text: There is lots of shopping and resteraunts around the hotel grounds, but most are a little expensive for my tastes.
reviews.title: Large and Busy
Great hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the HHV at the beginning of August for our Wedding Anniversary, it is a lovely hotel and very impressive upon arrival. The grounds are fantastic, with the penguins and flamingos.

reviews.title: What a rip off!!!
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel I told them it was our Wedding Anniversary and they offered a room upgrade straight away with no charge even though the hotel was at its maximum capacity, this did mean it had to be cleaned and we had to wait 3 hours but we went and ate and had a walk around while they stored our luggage. It was well worth the wait the room was in the Rainbow Tower on the 27th Floor with an ocean view – it was absolutely fantastic – the only thing I could say for the first few minutes was WOW.

reviews.title: Loyal Hilton guest says...nice hotel but average resort
reviews.text: The only downside is that you do have to pay for the tea and coffee and even bottled water in the room whereas most hotels this is complimentary. But we just took others advice and went to the ABC store and bought them all for a lot less.

It is definitely in the best area of Waikiki, we walked the length of the beach up to the main area and the beach is a lot narrower there and obviously more crowded, it can get a little busy directly in front of the hotel, but if you turn right then it is a little quieter there but the beach attendants aren’t allowed to put umbrellas down that area so there won’t be any shade, but we didn’t mind this. The sunbeds are expensive to rent 25$ for the 2 all day, but only being there for 5 days we didn’t mind that – we did buy 2 airbeds to start with which was only 7$ and sat on those the first day which is a cheaper way of doing it and you see lots of people with the same idea. We sometimes like to sit by the pool but there was no way I was queuing up in a morning by the pool until it opened to get a lounger, it was then in complete shade by the afternoon anyway. We watched from the balcony as they opened the pool and it was funny, as we literally watched them run for the sunbeds!!!
reviews.title: Hilton is overrated

likes.liked: — The room was lovely; well appointed, nice view
likes.disliked: — the cost and poor staff attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was a bit mixed, a couple of days the sun didn’t burn the cloud off until 11.30 and then by 4pm it was cloudy again but in between these times it was scorching hot! So if you like the sun don’t take shade and plan on coming back out when it is cooler as you may have missed the sun by then!!
reviews.title: Very nice but quite expensive!

reviews.text: Oahu was the final leg of our honeymoon trip, the first two being San Francisco (Westin St Francis) and Las Vegas (Bellagio).
reviews.title: Overpriced, overcrowded and over rated

reviews.text: We paid the top price for a Ocean Front room in the Rainbow Tower, and I have to say that I was very disappointed in the size and quality of the room, way below that which we had already experienced on our trip. We got unpacked, put on the AC, and noticed a really bad smell, when we checked the vent and noticed that it was covered in a black mould, which didn't bode well for what was going on behind.
reviews.title: Lots of Benefits

reviews.text: I went to talk to the manager about the standard of the room and the state of the AC, he said that he would have the AC checked, and would see if we could be moved to another room.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service, But needs Bigger Pool

reviews.text: The vent was cleaned, but that didn't help the smell, later on that day we were moved to a corner room on the 29th floor, with two balconies, one overlooking the complex, and one overlooking the beach. This was a nicer room, and larger, but the bathroom was still small and nothing like four star standard.
reviews.title: Incredible staff

reviews.text: The pools were very crowded, impossible to get a bed unless you were there by 9am, $51 for an umbrella and two beds on the beach is just a rip off, walk 100 yards towards town and get them for $20 instead.
reviews.title: Big complex, big bill but still good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I returned from 5 nights at the HHV yesterday, and we couldn't be happier with the resort. We were on the 34th floor of the Tapa Tower and were upgraded to a partial ocean view room (really was a full ocean view in our opinion), that was quite large. Yes, the resort is a little pricey (especially the drinks), but you can get around this partially by buying drinks and breakfast in the ABC store on the property. The only thing that really bugged me was paying for local calls.
reviews.title: A massive, wonderful resort! Amazing service.

likes.liked: — Amazing service, beach not nearly as crowded as rest of Waikiki.
likes.disliked: — Local phone calls not included in price, and drinks were too expensive.

reviews.text: The service is top notch in all respects. We were especially happy with the Hilton Grand Vacation Club staff (Reinna), and the entire team at Bali By the Sea (one of the best meals, if not the best, I have ever had). Because the Hilton has its own section of the beach and is on one end of Waikiki, the beach is much less crowded than in front of the other Waikiki beach hotels (where you are lucky to see the sand). You could spend your entire vacation on the property and never eat in the same restaurant or shop in the same store twice, it is really like a Vegas resort (without the gambling). We would definitely go back and recommend to anyone (other than the very frugal).
reviews.title: Very pleased with this resort!

reviews.text: Our family of five stayed in a two room suite on the 16th floor of the Diamond Head Tower. The room was dated and a little worn but very clean. The staff did an excellent job of keeping it clean our entire stay. Although it was a tight squeeze to get in a cot, the staff member who brought it up worked hard to move around some furniture and make it work. He went out the door as soon as he was done and I had to run after him to give him a much deserved tip! Our room had two large lanais with sweeping ocean and beach views.
reviews.title: Pleased with our recent stay at HHV

reviews.text: The resort has lots of great activities. My children enjoyed ,feeding the turtles and watching the penguins. They also enjoyed the koi fish ponds, the birds, and all of the water fountains. They enjoyed watching the Tiki Torch lighting ceremony each evening. The fireworks show over the beach, which followed The King's Jubilee celebration , was lots of fun.
reviews.title: Hilton Hawaiian Village was expensive, but Fabulous!

likes.liked: — Right on Waikiki Beach, free hula and lei-making lessons, clean, beautiful room
likes.disliked: — Expensive restaurants, staff always looking for a tip, cleaning staff not leaving coffee in room each day

reviews.text: The ABC store in the Rainbow Bazaar is pretty well stocked and has the same exact prices as any ABC Store on the island. You can find lots of great deals in these stores. The Round Table Pizza was a fun, inexpensive place to eat. This was also located in the Rainbow Bazaar. There are lots of shops to browse all through the resort. My kids enjoyed the ABC Store and the Honolulu Cookie Company. The Honolulu Cookie company offers free samples of their delicious pineapple shaped shortbread cookies. The cookies are quite tasty and they make excellent gifts as they are individually wrapped and gift boxed. The prices were quite reasonable and were the same on the hotel property as anywhere else.
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.text: This Hilton is huge, like it says, it’s a village with about 4 hotel towers surrounding the inner circle of restaurants, swimming pools, shops etc... But it’s not packed in and you’re not overlooking anyone.
reviews.title: It was OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was fast and friendly. The room was lovely with stunning views from our balcony of the resort and beach!
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!

reviews.text: The room was of a good size and the bathroom spacious and clean!
reviews.title: Perfect location!!!
Expensive, but Superior Resort
reviews.text: Each tower has its own spa facilities and pools, but you can go to the others, but it’s a 5 min trek to get there and not really worth it you would be better off going to the beach which is fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 12-22 to the 29th. Very nice hotel with excellent staff. Mary Jane at the front desk upgraded us to the rainbow Towers and it was a fantastic room. Yes its a Hilton and the prices are high. Draft beer is $7.00 and internet is $14.99 but its a beach Hiltlon! Tons of stores on the property with shopping close. Lots of great places within a short walk to eat and shop at for a lot less. Senior Frogs...Spagetti Factory..ect. The time share presentation is about 1.5 hours and they will give you $100 in hilton Dollars to use at stores and resturants. The place is packed so if you want seclusion dont go here. About a $30 taxi ride to the hotel from the airport.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a convention. Great location, right on the beach. It was pretty expensive, I was glad someone else was picking up the tab. At the time of my stay, there was a considerable amount of construction going on in and around the hotel. One of the two lanai's had cables dangling in front of it for a painting platform, similar to window washer. Overall, it is a very nice place, just be prepared to spend some $$. Keep in mind, it is Hawaii and everything is expensive!
reviews.title: Great Location But Pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel with Hilton quite a bit for work. While I often get upgraded, nothing could compare to the room, the service, the staff, the location, and the ease of staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We were upgraded to a suite on the 26th floor of the Rainbow Tower. It was bigger than my first apt. It had 2 balconies (overlooking the harbor) and 2 full baths. We enjoyed the room so much that we didn't want to leave. Also, it is extremely convenient to shopping, restaurants, etc. The staff was so warm and friendly. We could have spent a whole week there instead of just the 2 nights we were there. The free buffet breakfast was outstanding, the beach was quiet (considering it is on Waikiki). The grounds are very well maintained - don't miss the penguins! so cute! There is even a beautiful little chapel if you are getting married or renewing your vows. There is live entertainment in the evenings and it was just so-so.
reviews.title: Fantastic property!!!!

likes.liked: — Everything - the staff, the location, the grounds, the penguins
likes.disliked: — Have to pay for internet service

reviews.text: We loved Oahu, but we would not stay at the Hilton again. We chose it b/c it was the only resort listed with a kid's pool, but when we got there, we realized there were only 4 lounge chairs at the pool, and the rest were tables belonging to the Hau Tree Bar and you had to buy something to sit there (the wait staff bugs you until you do).
reviews.title: Would not stay here again

likes.disliked: — Poorly organized, (many) rude staff, bad beach

reviews.text: Also, they charge for ridiculous things like .50 cents a minute to check your email and then you have to hike to the front office to pay before you begin. The towels are a huge pain (you have to walk down to the beach to get them and then stand in a raft rental line.) If you get them from the Tapa pool, you'll be charged $20 if you don't return them there (hope someone's on duty when you do!), which they fail to mention when you pick them up. For some reason, this is the only pool that does this.
reviews.title: good but expensive

reviews.text: We just got back from 4 nights at the Hilton Hawaiin Village and had a wonderful time. Location is great - at end of Waikiki with great beach access and walking distance to variety of shops and dining options. Stayed at the Alii towers which is worth the extra money (we explored all the pools and it was nice to come back to ours for a spa and free appetizers in the late afternoon). Started our stay with firework show as the kids played in the surf (great way to start a trip if it falls on a Friday evening). Recommend renting a car to explore the island and drive up the coast. If your a "Lost" fan, you will find many spots that you will remember from the show. Pearl Harbor is worth a day trip which should include a trip to the Missouri and Bowfinger sub. Recommendation for a nice dinner would be Ocean View (about 2 hotels away in the Outrigger), also Todai is a fun sushi and seafood frenzy in all you can eat style (highlight of my 11 yr. olds trip).
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

likes.liked: — Great Location, Ocean view, distance to the beach

reviews.title: oasis in the city
reviews.text: We found staff to be very helpful and genuine from the Bellman's initial greeting of "Welcome Home!" to the valet's closing remark of "Mahalo, have a safe flight and hope to see you again."

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: yes waikiki is busy and crowded , sometimes like chicago during rush hour, but we find that the hilton hawaiian village is like an oasis in the middle of all the hustle and bustle , no matter how much you've heard about waikiki its rare blend of sensual ambiance and sophisticated packaging must be experienced to be understood . there's really nothing about waikiki that isn't unique , but there are places that will remain glued to your memory cells like snapshots of your trip to the islands , and the hilton hawaiian village is one of those places with its torch lit path ways and soft night breezes .
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon!

likes.liked: — The comfortable bed, one of the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Introduction: We stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort & Spa from July 1st-10th in Rainbow Tower R2309. I am a Silver HHonors member. This was our first visit to Hawaii for our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel

likes.liked: — Resort size and amenities without having to leave it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Loved This Place

reviews.text: It was excellent, great pools, great beach area, great breakfast options, and other food options as well. A very service-oriented staff.
reviews.title: Great locatio, great service, great amenities

reviews.text: I was fortuneate to have had the opportunity of staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for three nights at the Kalia Tower in late April and two nights at the Rainbow Tower in mid-May as the stopover point on a trip to Australia. What a wonderful way to begin and end this vacation!!!!
reviews.title: Lovely Resort with a Fabulous Staff
Has Anybody Seen Our 2 Bedroom Suite?
reviews.text: The property is absolutely gorgeous...spotlessly maintained on the widest stretch of Waikiki Beach. Flamingos and penguins, orchids and koi pools, parrots with "Aloha" greetings all add to the tropical appeal of this resort.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: The shops offer everything from Louis Vuitton to a very family friendly ABC convenient store. Restaurants are casual beachside to gourmet cuisine. There is truly something for most everyone's taste and budget.

However, I was most impressed by the staff. They were professionals in the art of customer service with emphasis on courtesy and helpfulness with a smile. Early arrival rooms were available on both stops with a minimal wait and great attention to our luggage. Shops' staffs assisted with post cards and more expensive purchases with the same great care. Wait staff were personable and attentif. I cannot say enough about my encounters with them. They did a fabulous job representing Hilton Hotels and the Hawaiian Islands!
reviews.title: Give the buffet a miss at all costs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the HHV for 5 nights for our Honeymoon. Wished we had stayed in Maui longer and never came to Oahu. Maybe if HHV had accomodated us and taken care of us on our Honeymoon it would have made a difference but HHV did not take care of us AT ALL.
reviews.title: Slightly disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, our travel agent booked us a room in the Rainbow Tower and confirmed with us repeatedly that we were in the Rainbow Tower. When we checked in, it took an HOUR with some trainee because there was a mistake with our reservation. Our travel agent supposedly NEVER booked us in the Rainbow Tower AND she booked us with 2 double beds. In the end, this was true our travel agent made a MAJOR mistake but you would think that HHV would accomodate us as it is our honeymoon AND september IS low season. But they didn't and they couldn't have cared less about us. They put us in the Tapa tower (albeit in a renovated room with a king size bed) but we were NOT satisfied!
reviews.title: fantastic!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HHV is a beautiful resort...the animals are great... the staff at the information desk are extremely friendly! The front desk staff stinks! The housekeeping were very nice as well and our room was always clean.
reviews.title: dream holiday!!

likes.disliked: — a little pricey,great for special occasion

reviews.text: But I will NEVER stay in the HHV again because of this incident. It was our HONEYMOON and they did NOTHING, NOTHING to make it memorable.
reviews.title: Convenience and luxury all in one place

likes.liked: — Variety of shopping and restaurants in a convenient location

reviews.text: We are seriously disappointed and disatisfied with the service we received. So... if I were you, if you do wish to stay at this hotel make sure BEFORE you arrive in Hawaii that your reservations are confirmed and that you are in the room you paid for. Believe me, HHV WILL NOT take care of you if there is a mistake.
reviews.title: Very loud and forget the customer service for Diamond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I started our Hawaiian vacation at the HHV for 2 nights. This is huge resort (which we knew) on massive grounds. We found the resort itslef to be very beautiful, clean, and located in a great area of Wakiki.
reviews.title: Very Average
If youre looking for a Tropical Hawaiian feel...this is the place to stay
reviews.text: We did find the service to be a bit lacking. My husband & I are both Hilton Honor Gold members, and had to almost beg for the upgrade that we are supposed to get automatically. (we never even got one, and ended up garden view in the Kalia Tower). I was furious,since I had read many reviews on trip advsior in which people were upgraded for no reason, at all. Our HH guidelines state that upgrades will be granted when available - and they were not (b/c they were given to thers for no reason!!!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The waitress at the Super Pool was non-existant. There was one poor waitress for the whole pool. It averaged 20 minutes to get a beer. We ordered food and the garbage sat around for over 2 hours before it was finally removed.
reviews.title: The absolute best in Waikiki

reviews.text: Our other main concern was the concierage. Our first one, Tony was AMAZING. However, the woman that we got later in our stay was horrid. She barley spoke a lick of English. We described that we wanted to go somewhere on the beach - nicer than Duke's....she said she couldn't help us b/c she was not familiar w/Dukes. Duke's is the most popular restaurant in Waikiki - this was laughable - she had nothing to recommend. Shame on the Hilton for having someone this lacking of training in their biggest resort.
reviews.title: Best Beach in Waikiki

reviews.text: Overall, our stay was very average - just like any other Hilton, except we were not welcomed as return or valued guests.
reviews.title: Absolutely first rate hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in the ali tower which was very well done. The beds were very comfy. My favorite was the bathroom setup it was divided into three large areas bathroom , shower and sink, huge dressing area with walk in closet& more sinks all separated by doors. It made it very helpful since we were traveling with two boys.Room well done and recently updated. We had a pov which was great because it also overlooked the superpool where the show and fireworks were on fri. night, just watch from balcony . Food at the chinese restaraunt on site was fabulous worth the money, pricy. We also did the rainbow tower buffet breakfast great if free or coupon but not worth full price. The snack bar at ali tower great quick food. You must walk down beach for $2.00 giant shaved ice they were the best.
reviews.title: Kids loved hhv

reviews.text: We enjoyed pearl harbor and then walked to famous swap meet a few blocks away cheap to get in and worth it, tons of great deals torists and locals use this swap meeet . I think its only on Sat.,Sun. and weds. at stadium. We took cabs both ways at $35..00 a trip definately could do this cheaper with shuttles but alot more wait time with shuttles. Pearl harbor go early it does sell out.Last Dukes Canoe Club Way overrated our least favorite meal on oahu long waits and poor service and hotel was flooded due to rains and stunk.Loved walking along shops at Wakiki. Oahu is a must do but I wouldn't spend more than a few days then hit Maui or another island. Yes, we were rained out on part of our stay but made the best of it. Lots to do. I hope this helps I read this site alot before my trip and got lots of tips. Such a friendly island.
reviews.title: Beautiful location. . .but service sure isn't what it should be. . .

reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights in the Ali'i Tower, which is nice, but probably not worth a return trip. It's close to the beach, has its own pool (quite small, but a very nice sundeck) and a nice continental breakfast each morning from 6:30-10. They charge $14, although I received it free with my AMEX platinum card. I am not sure I would have paid $14/day otherwise. The two ladies who work there in the morning are lovely. The rooms are nice, have flat screen tvs, a comfortable bed and couch, and nice lanais. It does include coffee and water, which apparently some of the other towers don't. They are supposed to come with turn-down service each night where they restock, but I needed to specifically ask for it 2 of the 3 nights. Eventually they did come, so all's well that ends well.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: I laughed at how hard the property tries to keep you on site. Between all the restaurants, shops, and the nice strip of beach, you really would never have to leave.
reviews.title: HHV got it right, great trip for hard to please Gold Member
Classic hotel
reviews.text: The retailers are top of the line (Louis Vuitton, Maui Divers, etc). The people who work there are lovely and professional (esp Cindy in Maui Divers and both Laura and Laurie in Louis).

reviews.title: Hotel room was fine; some aspects not so good
reviews.text: Stayed 8 nights in April. Check in was a little slow; requested a king bed and the person had to search for 20 minutes to find me a room with one. Finally received a nice corner room in the Tapa Tower with a partial ocean view. Bed was really comfy and I had a little bar area with a small refrigerator. Like many hotels, the walls are paper-thin ... was kept up for several hours by my next door neighbors who were foreign and had no courtesy at all.
Hotel grounds are nice, enjoyed the flamingos and penguins, and there were several shops just steps away. Ideal location on Waikiki Beach ... easy walk to several restaurants and stores.
reviews.title: Love this paradise!

reviews.text: I hope this doesn't come across as being insensitive, but my only real complaint is that this property caters to the Far East clientele and they appear to have a nonchalant attitude toward everyone else. That may be an overexaggeration, but it really feels that way. I know that the Asian demographic is their bread and butter, but I felt as if I was a foreigner in a state in my own country.
reviews.title: Rainbow Tower

reviews.text: I guess this review may sound a bit low, but I would choose another hotel if I came to Honolulu again.
reviews.title: Overrated and expensive!

reviews.text: We visited march 30-April 7,2012.Our room was in the Rainbow tower on the 24th floor ocean front room. It was Gorgeous!!!! We had seen some negative reviews but did not experience them? The elevator system was great, you just have to know how to use it. The pools were cold but the ocean is right there. The only thing that we found true were the prices in the resort were high,but there are many places to go within walking distance. We found great prices at the beginning of the beachwalk that gets you into town. The Subway has cheaper prices then the hotel. You can't beat 3.75 for breakfast! We are missing it so much and can't wait to go back!!!!
reviews.title: Hotel rooms.

reviews.text: This is the second time I've stayed at this resort. The resort itself is fabulous, the best on Waikiki. However, your room experience will vary depending upon the tower where you are located. The first time I stayed here in Sept. '04, I was in the Kalia Tower, which was excellent. It is one of the resort's newest towers. As a Hilton Honors member, we were upgraded to the executive level and had free breakfast and snacks, all for $200/night. For this trip (July '05), we stayed in the Tapa Tower. Not as nice. Was not given an upgrade. The room is older, and the bathroom always had a mildewy smell. Had a partial ocean view, though. When you make your reservation, you should call the hotel and request the tower that you want. Kalia is the way to go, not Tapa.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but stay in the Kalia Tower (not Tapa)
Beautiful Resort
reviews.text: We spent a week at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. 6/23/05-6/30/05

reviews.title: Nice hotel but too impersonal
reviews.text: What a wonderful resort. I would recommend staying there to everyone. The resort was one of the most beautiful places I have ever been. Our son and his fiancé were married there and the wedding was beautiful. All of the arrangements were handled by the Hilton and they did a perfect job. The staff was great! Our room was wonderful, we stayed in the Rainbow Tower. We were right on the Ocean and that was nice to walk out of our hotel and be right on the beach. From our room we had a view of the ocean, lagoon and pier. There was entertainment every night and it was top notch. Within the resort there were a lot of restaurants and shops, they were pricey, but if you don't mind walking a little bit you can find more reasonably priced places to eat and shop. Don't miss going to the International Market place to shop. I can't wait to go back someday. What a wonderful place. Hats off to the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

My husband and I stayed in the Tapa tower July 8-15 2005. We had specifically requested a king bed when we booked 6 weeks ago but they were unable to accomodate us upon check-in. We were put in a room with 2 doubles. The next morning I called to see if they could switch us and was told nothing had opened up and they didn't anticipate being able to move us for the entire stay. I expressed my displeasure again and upon furthur checking they were able to find a king room. The room we were moved to was pretty nice - large room, nice view, but in my opionion was dated and in need of some renos. If you require any assistance from the front desk, don't bother going down there - huge line ups. You're better off calling, hopefully they call you back if they are too busy. It was a pretty nice hotel but it really lacks personality. Not too sure I would go back.
reviews.title: Awesome!!!

reviews.text: My son (12) and I stayed in the Rainbow Tower, 29th floor. The view was spectacular, the accommadations were great and the people and workers were extremely friendly. The pool does get crowded but if you get there early your are sure to get a chair. The kids will not need a chair since they will be running the entire day. There are great places to eat, steakhouses, Japnaese, etc and nothing anymore expensive than the Outback in NC. We had a wondrful, wonderful time and we plan on returning in July/06
reviews.title: Ohio loves the Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just got back from an 8 night stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Check in was quick and we were upgraded to an ocean view room on the 19th floor in the Rainbow Tower. We had a corner room with views of both Diamond Head and the marina. The hotel has everything you could need, breakfast, lunch, dinner, and drinks. We got all of our gifts at the ABC store right in the resort. The grounds were beautiful. The pool was huge and the maitais were overpriced, but delicious! The Hilton has the best beach in the area. Not crowded at all. When I go back to Honolulu I won't stay anywhere else!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Waikiki!

reviews.text: I came here with a friend since she had some Hilton Points to use. How can anyone complain about Hawaii? The stay was OK. we were in what they considered the "nice" tower but we looked at a garage roof...it was a strain to see the beach. I don't prefer this environment because tourists don't want to leave! there is so much more to see and experience here. Too many of the same shops, and those cookies they leave you aren't so hot. But besides that, the location is a bit out of the way and you sit forever in traffic to get to it. walking isn't convienient to get down into the heart of Waikiki. The beach however, is great in front of the Hilton, hardly any coral, although each time I go back to the beach it seems to change. no matter where I stay I end up walking down the beach until I reach the strip by the Hilton. It's just not as crowded. But staying here, probably wouldn't do it again unless I got an amazing deal. I hardly spend time in a room anyhow. There is just so much to see and do. 8th time there will be a charm, and my goodness I still haven't done all there is to do.
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.text: GREAT RESORT, ESPECIALLY IN WAIKIKI
reviews.title: Great Resort!

likes.disliked: — charging for workout room and internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never visiting Hawaii before, I was quite excited about coming especially since we were supposedly staying on a world class beach right? Think again.
reviews.title: Magnificent as always

likes.liked: — The people - they really make or break your experience
likes.disliked: — The prices of food, drink, etc. (Waikiki can be pricey if you stay in the touristed areas)

reviews.text: Before making our reservation at the Hawaiian Hilton, I was dancing back and forth deciding which resort to stay at. WE ARE SO LUCKY I made the right choice!
reviews.title: Nice, but busy

likes.liked: — That my company paid for it
likes.disliked: — Expensive and over crowded. Very hard to get around.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in the Kalia Tower. The room was very spacious and overlooked the sea. Although there was building work going on we were never disturbed by it. Stayed in the hotel with 14 other people, others stayed in the Kalia Tower, Rainbow Tower and one begining with an A I can't think of the name but it was the posh one, with it's own doorman. Whole village was brilliant although a little pricey, as there was more than 7 of us most of the time they autmatically added on 15% service charge. I read reviews about being charged for tea/coffee in rooms but this was not true. We had the wedding meal in the Bali on the Sea restaurant and the evening was perfect, the food was devine and the waiting staff superb, they gave us plastic cups so we could drink our champaigne on the beach after we had finished our meal and gave us complimentary truffles.
reviews.title: wedding meal

likes.disliked: — 15% service charge but this is all over America

reviews.text: We booked an "ocean view" room in the Rainbow Tower. There was a nice view of the harbor, but the only way you could actually see the ocean from our room would be to step out onto the balcony and lean over to see a small sliver of Pacific. I complained that this did not constitute an "ocean" view in my mind, but the hotel staff told me that is how the room is classified, and refused to move us.
reviews.title: Caveat on 'Ocean View' Room

likes.disliked: — Non ocean view for ocean view price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other then this disappointment, the hotel was great.
reviews.title: You MUST stay here!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here, last year during Christmas week. Although a little pricey, it's worth every penny. We had a room with an Ocean view. Within a short elevator ride and a (less than) 5 minute walk, we were right on the beach. The rooms were spacious, immaculately clean and came with small fridges. The beds were nice, fluffy and inviting. The staff was EXTREMELY friendly and ya can't beat the location. It's has a small mall in it with lots of restaurants to eat. We also loved the atmosphere and "ambiance".
reviews.title: Happy at the Hilton

reviews.text: I was born and raised on Oahu but have lived on the mainland for the last 16 plus years, during which time I had not been home to Hawaii until now. I spent 4 nights at the HHV in early April.
reviews.title: Excellent, but bring money! (Lots of it)

reviews.text: Awesome place to stay and great for families.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Hilton Hawaiian Village

likes.liked: — View of Diamond Head and location of hotel
likes.disliked: — Food was expensive but that is expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just recently came back from a 13 nights stay at the HHV. A very good experience overall. We had problems however at check in. We had checked in in advance earlier in the day via internet on the Hilton site being hilton honnors members. We had been assigned a room with King size bed in the Rainbow tower oceanview and 32nd floor which sounded fantastic. Upon our arrival on the property around 9 pm she wanted to give us a room with two beds.. this was our first wedding anniversary and 13 nights in two beds.. could not do. It was very frustrating since we had reserved months in advance a king size bed and had been assigned a much better room on the web site earlier in the same day. She managed to find us a king size bed in another tower but we really did not appreciate the treatment and it took her a long time to find something else. She never really explained who had gotten my room or if it was available or not.
reviews.title: very good experience

likes.liked: — best beach part on Waikiki and the overall look of the resort
likes.disliked: — check in procedures, price of beach chairs and umbrellas and the timeshare publicity

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.text: The rest of our stay was very pleasant. The hotel is big and very busy but it is the best section of the beach in Waikiki by far and it does not feel too crowded on the beach. The fact that it almost never rains in Waikiki beach (20 inch per year) compared to other beaches and the rest of Oahu ( up to 200 inches per year..) is to take into account and can make up for it being more busy then elsewhere. The umbrellas and chairs rented by the company on the beach is a major rip off (60 US each day..) but at least you don't worry about having to rush there early morning to reserve one to be sure to get some shade in the day since if you are willing to pay there are always some available.

The hotel has really made an effort to integrate Hawaiian culture in the decorations which are quite impressive everywhere on the resort. You also get cultural activities like Lei making, Hula dance classe and Ukulele lessons opportunities almost every day on site which is very nice. The resort is very impressive with well laid out lush vegetation and nice animals of varous kinds which makes it quite unique in its kind. /They had a show every night around 6 pm of hula dancing which was quite fun and on Fridays it is longer with fireworks. Some live music at different places on the resort starting at 4 pm every night is also very good. They light up the property at night by torch and they do a ceremony of this lighting every night at the beginning of the show.
reviews.title: Good Trip

reviews.text: We really appreciated to have in the resort many boutiques of all price ranges from the ABC store to get cheap snacks and things to L Vutton accessories. It was pleasant to stroll the boutiques at night and it was not more expensive here then elsewhere in town. The proximity of Ala Moana shopping center at a few blocks was also nice. The Borders music and book shop of Ala Moana shopping center has an amazing selection of Hawaiian music if of interest to you. The restaurant were also varied and very good. We tried most of them. Some things are overpriced like the tropical drinks which cost almost $10 each but the location of the bars being directly on the beach kind of made us feel it was ok for them to ask that much. It was possible to eat for a reasonable price at other meals without being too expensive.
reviews.title: Loved the view

likes.liked: — Destination in itself, very nice beach, lots of shopping
likes.disliked: — Having to pay extra to use in roof safe.

reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel over Easter, and it was definitely an above average hotel. The entire complex is really it's own village. There are miles and miles of shops (extremely expensive) and lots of ABC stores (small convenience stores). I do think that dividing the hotel into 5 different towers was a good idea, otherwise the size of the place would be overwhelming. We stayed at the Kalia Tower, at the executive floors (top 22-25) in an ocean-view suite. The view was fantastic, and the room was nice, but average. Luckily, the executive floors recieved a free breakfast, snack and horderves, otherwise we would have been stuck paying the ridiculous prices ($13 for a regular hamburger, $21 for the good breakfast buffet) in the village. Something that sort of bothered us was that they charged for EVERYTHING, even the coffee for the coffee-maker in your room! Considering you pay over $400 per night for an oceanview suite, you would think they could at least throw in some coffee. Even cheap-o motels throw in coffee for free. All in all, for the money, you get a gorgeous hotel, with multitudes of pools and beach, and wonderful gardens, but you could probably do better to stay at a cheaper hotel near by and just walk through the gardens once in a while. However, if you love spectacular scenery and wish to stay in a place with tons of it, the Hilton Hawaiian Village is the place for you.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Stay in the Kalia Tower

reviews.text: *Also, a small footnote to add would be that we went on a FANTASTIC tour while we stayed on the island -- it wasn't too long and it took you to places you just don't see in Waikiki, gorgeous scenic photo opportunities too! We'd definitely reccomend it: E Moa Tours, and the "Grand Small Island" tour*
reviews.title: Ali'i Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian Village the best!

reviews.text: I stayed here a week for a conference and it was one of the most pleasant stays I've had in HNL. The Ali'i Tower is first class! I had large king room with ocean/city views that was extremely spacious. I had a small separate living space, desk, and a large flat screen TV. They had an afternoon ice service, turn down service, and this tower has it's own private pool!!! The pool was never crowded, quiet and peaceful. They also have a complimentary breakfast (continental) every morning. The HHV is a village: lots of shopping, excellent dining, lively bar (Tapa Bar). It is, from my understanding, the largest hotel on HNL, so expect a crowd when you venture outside of your tower. But the grounds are absolutely beautiful, the service wonderful, and the views breathtaking. I highly recommend it for families and business travelers alike.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience in Rainbow Tower
had the best time of my life. the staff was great and the hotel was too
reviews.text: P.S. Added plus for business travelers is their 24 hour full service business center (shipping, printing, internet, copying), WIFI spots, and wireless internet in your room with the ability to print to a nearby terminal from your room (front desk or business center).

reviews.title: Great Place For Family Vacation
reviews.text: Thanks to your reviews, when we booked Hilton Hawaiian Village, we booked Rainbow Tower which is closest to the Beach. Reviews here said the Hilton Hawaiian was like Grand Central Station if your room are close to the street, which is true if you're staying in the Tapa Tower because that is the Tower where the bus/shuttles pick up guests, so it literally is Grand Central Station and could be noisy. So even though the Rainbow Tower is the oldest Tower, it's the one closest to the beach and pool. We were on the 19th floor and had an ocean/beach view and we high up enough to see most of Waikiki. My only complaint about the room, was the shower head needed to be updated, otherwise it was great! Oh and don't touch any coffee or muchines from your room - you'll be charged, read the Snack card carefully! Just get treats from the ABC store in the Hilton - this store is jam packed all the time!

My mom and I stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village from Sept 14-18. Upon arrival at the hotel, we grabbed our bags and started the long walk from the Tapa Tower, where the airport shuttle dropped us off, to the Lobby. My mom wasn't too happy about the long walk, but we could have had someone bring our bags to our room. We just chose to cart them ourselves. I didn't realize it was such a walk. When we left, we did have someone bring our bags down and it was much better not having to drag them all over.
reviews.title: Loved the HHV!

reviews.text: When we arrived in the Lobby, we were greeted and given some yummy passion fruit juice, and I got in the Honors line to check in, only to find out we had to go to the Ali'i Tower to check in. I knew we were staying there, but thought you could check in at either place. So, more walking.. not too much further, but those bags were heavy, even with wheels. :D
reviews.title: LOVED OUR STAY AT THE HILTON HAWAIIAN VILLAGE!

reviews.text: Arriving at the Ali'i Tower, there was no one in line so I checked us in, asking if it might be possible to get a room facing Diamond Head. Tried to get a corner room, but she said that they are re-doing a bunch of them and there weren't any. We did get our Diamond Head view, though. Into the elevator and up to the 8th floor and around some more corners, and near the end of the hall, of course, and we finally arrived.
reviews.title: Loved the HHV

reviews.text: The room was beautiful, and opening the drapes I saw that while we were facing Diamondhead, you could only see the very tip as we were only on the 8th floor. Not sure if even on the 12th floor you could see much more as the Sheraton is blocking a good deal of the view. The ocean on the other hand was gorgeous. That's what we paid for, and we certainly got it. Last year we stayed at the Pacific Beach Hotel and had an awesome Diamondhead view, so this time we got the awesome ocean view.
reviews.title: We enjoyed it

reviews.text: The lanai had two chairs and a nice size glass table in between. Quite a large size for a lanai, I thought. I enjoyed the view a bit, and the sound of the ocean before unpacking a bit.
reviews.title: Too busy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really had a bad experience with this hotel located in such a beautiful place. The room we reserved at full rate, even paying extra for ocean view you hardly can find it on the picture, but you certainly don't have your privacy or your neighbors across the balcony. It is an expensive room with no value.
reviews.title: Stay Here: Really now to ruin a paradise vacation!

reviews.text: Just outside our balcony you are diving right into a construction site full of noise even before 8am and after 6pm as the management assured us they would not. We complained about the problem, and the manager really did not care much for our business, they said most customers are japanese and used to noise and problems without complaining much, like American's do!
reviews.title: Very nice property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only other room available was a 2 bedroom normally renting for $965/night which we could have for the bargain of an additional $150 dollars/night over our regular rate. We seriously considered it to avoid the noise, until we found out it was on the low floor directly across the construction site and the crane. The solution was worse than the problem... but for an extra fee!
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!!!!!

reviews.text: I certainly will not be staying here any time soon. The rooms are small with cheap finishings all around. For a plastic pre-fab shower i could go to motel 6, and be treated better. I don't expect it at $400/night, and be expected not to complain about it.
reviews.title: Wow!!!!

likes.disliked: — didn't like the birds that were around to much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the positive side, there are some great restaurants, nice pool, beautiful beach, superb surfing, fireworks once per week.
reviews.title: Relaxing Hilton Hawaian Village

reviews.text: so much going on, major construction going on. i read reviews so i did not book in lagoon tower. do your self a favor and don't book there now. noisey. food prices and shopping, expensive like in $$$$ for what it is. employees are very nice, and my room was great.. in tower i booked in. the hotel property is beautiful, and activity is just to be described as main street usa, at disneyland. NICE BUT NOT RELAXING..
reviews.title: busy busy busy

likes.liked: — room had a great view, comfortable bed, nice maid service, and happy employees
likes.disliked: — too many people, at the super pool, food prices outragious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: july 25 to july 30th,2007
reviews.title: Wife & I both loved it - we'll be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights, and had an absolutely wonderful time. Not quite up to one or two of the really world-class hotels I've been lucky to visit (the Hilton Jerusalem comes to mind in this chain), but great overall.
reviews.title: Loved the whole experience

likes.liked: — everything you need or want is at your fingertips
likes.disliked: — the first room we were given (I believe the Tapa Tower)

reviews.text: Our room was a large suite and had an ocean view and two balconies even though it was in one of the "lower end" towers for this complex, and the upgrade price of the breakfast buffet was well worth it even if just to watch the fish in the gorgeous koi pond (the food was great too).
reviews.title: Enjoyed the stay very much

likes.disliked: — Housekeeping was not consistent as to when they cleaned room

reviews.text: We also had a great late-arrival-from-the-mainland dinner at Benihana (not exactly exotic, but great for US hotel food, and just as importantly was open for a hearty meal even though we arrived after a lot of other things were closed). Didn't try the nicer restaurants there other than for breakfast because we were out and about most nights. The little cafe will make you a reasonable americano in the morning and has good pastries if you're not sticking around for breakfast. Parking our rental motorcycle in the parking lot was also never a problem, and the service was impeccable. The drinks from the beachfront lounge were not exactly strong, but hey, you can't have everything, and what do you expect at a place like this. :-)
reviews.title: Guests as nuisance

reviews.text: I have worked for a major airline for over 20 years, and have had the opportunity to travel to many places and stay in many hotels. This truly was one of the best! We went to Hawaii for the Hawaii Bowl, and didn't make a hotel reservation because of the stiff penalties for cancelling last minute. (traveling standby you never know if you are going to get on the plane or not!) So, we walked into the Hilton and were accomodated in the Ali'i Tower (nice sized rooms with concierge service and amenities) at an airline discount Christmas week!! Room was oceanfront, very large, very clean, flat screen, twice daily maid service, turn down service, private lanai etc. Beautiful wide beach, biggest on Waikiki. Tons of shopping and restaurants on property plus within walking distance of many stores and eateries off property. Spa (pricey). Childrens village (for a fee) Several pools/bars. Everyone was very polite and gave great customer service. We were granted a late check-out AND were given a courtesy room free of charge in the evening to shower and change after a long hot day at the Hawaii Bowl before going to the airport for our 11 pm flight. So great!! This is an option for everyone. Just request the service a day or so in advance so you can get the time that works for you. I would definitely stay at the Hilton again!
reviews.title: A Great Resort!

reviews.text: I guess it's a good place to stay , I don't have anything to compare it to as it was my first stay in Hawaii.
reviews.title: OK - but,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like visiting another US state, but with ridiculously high prices and clogged roadways, I guess Hawaii (Oahu) is the place to go.
reviews.title: Decent room and service

reviews.text: As far as the Hilton goes, stupid rules for getting towels (my 6 year old son had to be with my wife in order to obtain a towel), and $35 umbrella rentals and no chairs or lounge chairs on the beach unless you forked out cash, set me off the 1st day.
reviews.title: Our best family vacation

reviews.text: After that I was just annoyed with the lousy elevator service, and the
reviews.title: Impressed with the Hawaiian Hilton Village In Oahu

reviews.text: Our family of 4 just returned from an eight day vacation to Oahu, staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The Hilton is rather pricey , but the description of the property made me think it was going to be worth the extra dollars we would be spending on this beachfront hotel. My husband and I found the the service unreliable (even after repeated, daily requests to stock the room with towels and supplies for 4 people, they just never got it...! And little annoyances like our room key never working in the parking garage, etc.) and for the most part, unfriendly. Maybe it's because the Hilton is such a huge resort and "friendly/caring" just isn't part of the deal. Also, I agree with some of the other reviews of Waikiki hotels about the "nickel and diming" that goes on. The Hilton Village does its fair share of this practice, and it's almost a joke. Also, our "oceanfront" view room was "partial oceanfront" at best. And we woke to the sound of tour busses and trucks every morning - - all morning...We loved Oahu, but next time we will definitely stay someplace else!
reviews.title: Dissappointed in Service Level

likes.liked: — location was great, on the far end of the beach with good size beachfront
likes.disliked: — coldness/uncaring attitude of staff; POOR VALUE (price/service ratio);level of service

reviews.text: We stayed in the lagoon towers and had a 2 bedroom condo. It was great. The resort offers several restaurants from sushi to pizza. The shopping was all right there and had the same stores that were further down in Waikiki. The beach was easy to find a spot. The pool was nice but closed very early, (5:30 pm). The drawback is you are quite a ways from the main part of Waikiki and have to take a bus or taxi to that part. Plus, buses stop operating at 9 pm.
reviews.title: Everything at your fingertips

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights. The first night in the Tapa Tower...bad choice! Although we were on the 10th floor, the band playing at the Tapa Bar until 11pm was loud enough in our room to keep us awake when sleep was needed! We asked to be moved and were relocated to the Kalia Tower despite full hotel. The tower was beautiful - quiet, elegant, dedicated concierge and valet parking. In addition, a small private pool on the 4th floor for residents of the tower - nice! The grounds are pretty, although the "Super Pool" small for the size of the resort. Beach chairs were packed in and tight. You needed to come down at 8a to get a good seat! The village had lots of nice convenient shopping. Restaurant choices were diverse although pricey, and challenging for younger kids.
reviews.title: Ask for the Kalia Tower

reviews.text: Stayed here for 7 nights and absolutely loved everything about it! The property is not only gorgeous but very clean! Will definately stay here on the next trip.
reviews.title: Loved This Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I got the opportunity to stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Oahu this summer as part of our trip through Hawaii.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Stay

reviews.text: I spent five nights here while attending a conference. This is a nice hotel that has been part of Waikiki for many years. The staff was exceptional. When I checked in and requested a King room, there was not one available. The front desk asked for my cell number and told me she would call me if one became available tomorrow. The next day, she found me a King room and changed my room. The rooms were clean. Everyone very friendly. I would stay again anytime.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: This resort is so huge it defies description. There are more people staying in this resort in one day than live in my entire community! The rooms were very nice with lots of room to spread out. Compared to the rooms at the Aston Waikiki, we thought we had the penthouse suite! My only real complaint is not the fault of the resort as much as just the sheer size of the place and the rules that Hilton has in place. We paid over $250 per night, but there was no place on the property where you could get wireless for free. Its a huge pet peeve of mine. Even the two Starbucks on property didn't have wireless! When have you seen a Starbucks without wireless service!
reviews.title: Monstrous Property/Expensive as Heck/Great Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is very nice, the swimming is good, lots to do, but everything costs a lot of money. An umbrella and two chairs for the day is $60! This is the type of place you can come and never have to leave. Its not my family's style of travel, but that is not the hotel's fault. I probably would not come back mainly because we would look for someplace that is a little more quaint.
reviews.title: Heaven in Hawaii

reviews.text: The pools were literally packed with people and mostly kids. I have to say the hospitality service on our flight day was fantastic! They took our bags while we went to the beach and we scheduled to have a room to take a shower and get ready to fly out on the redeye. it was an awesome service and came off exactly as they said it would!
reviews.title: Don't stay here if you are a business traveler

reviews.text: So my basic advice is that if you have a big, fat wallet and want to stay in monstrous but well run resort, this is it!!!
reviews.title: Great location, average facilities
You will have a Great Time here
reviews.text: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a great place to stay especially with kids.

reviews.title: Bait and switch
reviews.text: I just returned from a trip over the 4th of July with my 6 yr old son, 14 yr old niece, mom and stepdad. We stayed in the Ali'i Tower. It was awesome. We had a fantastic view of the super pool and part of the beach from our room. Even with a child and a teenager sharing a room with me we had plenty of space and the bathroom was very large and compartmentalized so that it could be used by multiple persons at the same time without problem. Even though this tower had extra amenities I don't think you'd miss them much staying in any other of the towers. We weren't in the room enough to really use them and all the towers are beautiful. However the availability of a concierge was very helpful in getting us a dinner reservation at a specific time that I was unable to get calling the restaurant directly. That was pretty cool.
The entire place is open and airy and just way cool. I have traveled a lot and my mom and stepdad are very avid travelers. They were very surprised with the hotel and loved it.
reviews.title: Too Crowded & Commercial
We had a great time!
reviews.text: If you want that tropical Hawaiian feeling this is the place. Huge pools, great beach, friendly people and just unbelievable grounds with ponds and wildlife just hanging out. You can't go wrong with this hotel if you want a fun vacation.

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: PS: But you must make a side trip and visit Kailua on the windward or south east coast. The best beach I've ever been to and you have to eat at Teddy Burger. Oh what I'd do for a Teddy Burger, yummy!

aka: Hilton Hawaiian Village Waikiki Beach Hotel Honolulu
description: Located on Waikiki's widest stretch of beach, the Hilton Hawaiian Village Waikiki Beach Resort is nestled on 22 oceanfront acres offering the perfect mix of exceptional hotel accommodations and classic Hawaiian hospitality. Imagine five spectacular pools, lush tropical gardens, waterfalls, exotic wildlife and priceless artwork. As Waikiki's only true resort, we offer a perfect blend of luxurious accommodations, over 20 restaurants and lounges, shopping, recreational and cultural activities, nightly entertainment and more!
